campaign.story:
Chart the rise and fall of the East India Company in this cutting negotiation game about high society at the dawn of the British Empire. Created by Cole Wehrle, the award-winning designer of Root and Pax Pamir, John Company: Second Edition is a deep and thoughtful design from a master builder of historical games. 
John Company is the second game in our series on the British Empire. In our previous game (Pax Pamir), players attempted to construct a new future for a land caught between two global rivals. This game presented agents of empire as hapless interlopers, caught up in a struggle that they could scarcely understand.
In John Company, players move deep into the bowels of empire and take the roles of ambitious families out to make a name for themselves at the dawn of the British Empire. 
Though often upsetting, this vantage point offers a better understanding of how empires work in practice. Empire-building is one of the most common themes in game design, but the vast majority of games get the fundamentals completely wrong. Empires are certainly not heroic enterprises, but they are also not comic book villains, masterminding global domination. Instead, empires are something far more insidious. They are something that happens in aggregate, composed of a thousand little choices and many individuals with their own interests and ambitions. 
John Company thrusts players into those thousand little choices. As matriarchs and patriarchs of ambitious British families in the eighteenth and nineteenth century, players guide their children to positions of respectability. To do this they will often cajole for positions of power and prestige within the British East India Company. 
John Company offers players a new understanding of British history in the eighteenth and nineteenth century that reflects contemporary scholarship on the subject and extensive research into primary documents. John Company attempts to put the critical events of that time in their proper context and show how the imperial experience transformed the domestic culture of Britain. The East India Company lurked behind every building of a textile mill and every bit of wealth in a Jane Austen novel. 
John Company is an uncompromising portrait of the people who made the Company and the British Empire what it was. It is as frank as it is cutting in its satire.  Accordingly, the game wrestles with many of the key themes of imperialism and globalization in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries and how those developments were felt domestically. As such, this game might not be suitable for all players. Please make sure everyone in your group consents to this exploration before playing. 
If you'd like to read more about the game's arguments, click here. 
In John Company, players collectively guide the fate of the Company by securing positions of power and using them to benefit their own interests. As they climb through the Company's ranks, players will find themselves directing critical trade missions, bribing members of Parliament for favors, and jockeying for advantageous marriages during the London Season. If you've ever wanted to play a board game with the narrative scope and skullduggery of a Victorian novel, John Company is your game. 
John Company offers its players an  unparalleled economic sandbox that covers the history of the Company from 1710 to 1857 using four scenarios. Once players get comfortable with the games first scenario, they can explore a wide range of challenges, including the end of the Company's monopoly and the growth of enterprising private firms. 
Though massive in scope, John Company relies on a fundamentally simple core that teaches players how to play while they play. Turns begin with players assigning their children to various career paths and then continues through the step-by-step operation of the Company. Players are always able to negotiate so there's almost no downtime between actions.
Note: these rules are still in development and are not final.
John Company: Second Edition is a dramatic reimagining of the first edition that took over two years of extensive design and production work. 
The first edition of John Company had a very limited production budget. For this new edition, we have overhauled every element of the physical production and have done our best to make sure the design has never been more approachable for new players.
We have rebuilt every graphical element in the game to make John Company more immersive and playable. The rulebook has been dramatically expanded, with plenty of examples and a more conversational style. 


Just about everything players own can be exchanged at any time. The old promise system has been redesigned to provide players with the ability to give away future favors for crucial leverage in the heat of a negotiation. Players have never had so many ways to make a deal. 
The old event tables have been replaced with a new event system that is much easier to resolve. Use 20 beautiful punchboard tiles featuring hand-painted Ganjifa-style art by Amita Pai, to bring the subcontinent to life. Though few in number, these tiles create a dizzying array of possible situations, from the reemergence of Mughal authority, the rise of new kingdoms, or the aggressive rejection of the Company's efforts. 
For this new edition, we have dramatically improved the game's scenarios, especially those dealing with the deregulation of the Company. John Company also features a revolutionary new automata from well-regarded solo designer Ricky Royal. Players will find the negotiations no less fierce in the single and two player modes against a bot that is able to wheel and deal like a human player.
We're happy to be working with Backerkit again as our pledge manager to help with your pledge and process accurate shipping fees.  Pledge managers are third-party services that let you manage your order leading up to fulfillment. After the campaign, everyone will be emailed by Backerkit so that we can collect your delivery address, process payment for shipping and add-ons, and finalize your pledge!

Anyone who wishes to supplement their pledge with any of the add-ons may add that dollar amount to their pledge now or adjust their order in Backerkit after the campaign. 
Shipping will be charged post-campaign in Backerkit.
Customs Friendly: Wehrlegig covers the duty payments and customs fees for backers who receive our games in the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. All other countries or regions may be subject to additional customs fees upon delivery. For our UK backers,  we promise there will not be additional duty payments, so you can consider this project UK-friendly too.

For folks only pledging for smaller items like coins (Add-ons Only pledge level), shipping will be a fraction of the cost. Depending on your address, most small order shipping will cost less than 50% of the listed rate. 
We are are continuing our commitment to creating our games that are free and widely accessible anyone that is curious by making our game files available under Creative Commons license BY–NC–SA 4.0. That means we will continue offering a full, free print-and-play kit for Pax Pamir, and later this campaign, John Company! Anyone can use, remix, and share the game, so long as they do not use it for commercial purposes. 
At Wehrlegig Games our objective is simple: publish beautiful games with historical themes that treat their subjects and their players seriously. These are games that make arguments and encourage discussion. They don't shy away from difficult subjects.
We know the audience for such games is limited. In order for us to produce games up to our standards, we rely on a direct sales model. Our games are not designed for traditional distribution or retail channels. The vast majority of all copies produced will be sent to Kickstarter backers or to people who purchase games through our store.  This means we can spend many more resources on the game's physical production without having to worry about retail viability.
Cole Wehrle is a published writer and game designer who currently works at Leder Games in Saint Paul, Minnesota.  He is perhaps best known for designing Root, Pax Pamir, and Oath. Before working in the board game industry, Cole earned his PhD at the University of Texas where he worked on nineteenth century novels and the British Empire. 

Drew Wehrle is a game developer and co-founder of Wehrlegig Games. He handles all of the business and operational elements of Wehrlegig. As Cole's younger brother, Drew has helped develop and playtest every game he has designed. Drew previously managed school programs at Chicago Botanic Garden, and as of early 2020, he now manages Wehrlegig Games full-time.

Richard Wilkins is a British board game designer (Renegade, from VPG) and collaborator often engaged in designing and developing solo rules (Pax Pamir, Guilds of London, Tales of the Northlands: The Sagas of Noggin the Nog, On the Origin of Species).  You may better know him as Ricky Royal from the Box of Delights YouTube channel, where Ricky has been demonstrating how board games play for the past 9 years, predominantly to a growing community of solo gamers. As well as a hobbyist in the board game industry, Ricky is a graduate of Computer Science and a software professional of 30 years, with a love for the countryside, his family, and dog (though not necessarily in that order). 

Amita Pai is a commercial artist based out of Mumbai, India.  This is Amita's first board game project, bringing her hand painted Ganjifa art pieces to John Company and offering guidance to the visual design elements for the map of India  She loves painting, sculpting, and dancing. More of her art can be seen on her Instagram.

Amarjeet Bitke is a 3D Environment Artist from Pune, India. Amarjeet designed the resin game components to make them both functional and beautiful. John Company is Amarjeet's first board game as he is typically working on digital projects and modeling for video games! Check out his 3D modeling here.

Janek Lipiński is an illustrator and designer based in Warsaw.  Janek designed the family portrait illustrations for John Company, his first board game collaboration. While working as front-end developer, Janek's work extends from graphic design to watercolor  painting. You can see more of his art on display here.

Thank you to our collaborators: Travis D. Hill (Press Pot Games) for the rulebook support, David Carter for the extra customer service, and all the Backers that help bring our projects to life!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This campaign seeks to raise funds for the first printing of John Company: Second Edition as well as a third printing of Pax Pamir. At this point, all of the files for Pax Pamir are complete and we hope to begin production shortly after the campaign is over. John Company's files are not yet finished and will be staggered in the production timeline.

Drew will continue to manage Wehrlegig's projects full-time. We have built a wide network partnerships with folks around the gaming industry, and we have contingencies in place for every element of the project's production and fulfillment. 

We have built plenty of padding into our schedules to absorb delays, and we will continue to monitor and adapt our logistics planning to accommodate changes with international freight procedures. We are confident that we can deliver this game on time or with minimal delay.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge manager surveys are rolling out!
updates.update_content:
Hi all.

Exciting news! After delaying a few days, we have started sending out Backerkit pledge manager surveys. These Backerkit emails will be rolling out over the next day or so, so please be patient for your email to arrive.  Please reach out to support@wehrlegig.com if you have not received your email by Thursday. Backerkit surveys are sent to the email associated with your Kickstarter account.

Dear backers,
A few updates ago, I mentioned that the success of this campaign allowed me to spend the better part of the past month advancing the game's development. In more normal circumstances, most of my extra time would have been spent trying to direct as much attention to the campaign as possible. Thankfully, that extra effort wasn't needed, and I was able to continue working on the game more-or-less without interruption.

You've heard it before, and you'll hear it again. THANK YOU! You are all incredible backers.  You came out and brought this project to life, and we couldn't do it without you.
Cole and I took a few days to rest from the campaign, and now we're back at it. We spent the weekend in St. Paul working on John Company, and boy howdy, the coming months are going to be exciting. Graphic updates. Production samples. Design completion. We'll cover it all in future updates, but before we get there, let's do some house keeping and talk schedules.

Next Up

Dear backers,
First of all, I guess I should say hello. I am overwhelmed by how many of you have joined this campaign in just the past few days. If you are new to this Kickstarter or Wehrlegig Kickstarters specifically, let me tell you right at the start that I'm so glad to have your support. I cannot wait to share the next steps of this project with you all.
A few hours after we launched the campaign, it was clear that it would blow past our expectations. Drew and I are naturally pretty cautious people and so we did our best to ignore the campaign's success and just continue doing the sorts of things we like to do. We kept working on the game, kept editing rules, kept answering your questions.

updates.update_userinfo: The Final Stretch and a Surprise Stream
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
We have entered the final stretch of this remarkable campaign. Who would have guessed that a game like John Company could possibly raise over 700,000 dollars?! We'll be talking more about what the success of this campaign means for the project in the coming days and weeks, but I wanted everyone to know that the performance of this campaign has given Drew and I considerable latitude, and we cannot wait to tell you more about the game's production.

Hello Hello!

Quick status update. Since there are two separate printings happening during this campaign, we have a couple different timelines that I wanted to briefly mention before the campaign wraps up next week. 
We are already nearing the end of our pre-production phase for the 3rd printing of Pax Pamir, so we are still on schedule for mass production starting up in the coming weeks! Folks getting Pax Pamir and add-ons won't have to wait too long before getting their pledge, but this does mean that our Pledge Manager period will be somewhat shorter compared to other campaigns! After our campaign, we'll have a separate update with Pledge Manager instructions and an estimated timeline for the Pledge Manager window about when we need to lock pledges, charge cards, and confirm addresses.  John Company is a while from getting there, and John Company pledges will have a slightly different timeline for locking and confirming addresses etc, but we're still moving forward on development for the time being. Again, we'll have more details after the campaign about the Pledge Manager!

Hi Backers!

We just funded past $600,000 and that is ASTOUNDING. Cole and I can’t begin to tell you how thrilled we are to make and deliver our games at that scale. Clearly backers like you want to see more game like this! It is because of your direct support on this platform that we can make projects like this (and others in the future) with this same rigor we brought to Pax Pamir. Thanks for being here <3

updates.update_userinfo: Checking in + Shipping Rates + Artist Spotlight
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!

I will try my best to refrain from gushing about how grateful we are, and more so, how amazing our backers are. It is pretty incredible that we get to make games like John Company and Pax Pamir because of people like you directly supporting our work here on Kickstarter. I can’t say it enough--thank you!!

updates.update_userinfo: A little design chat and AMA
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I spent today pretty caught up in other designs and only had a chance to log onto the Kickstarter after work. My goodness. This campaign has exceeded every expectation. We're not even a week in and we've already passed Pax Pamir's reprint campaign. I'm speechless. 
When Drew and I launched this campaign, we were a little worried about the production because this game is expensive. But, with the response we've gotten so far, we aren't worried in the slightest. You've all given us space not only to produce the game we've dreamed of, you have also offered us the ability to make it even better in countless little ways that we will be detailing in the coming weeks and months. (Sadly we still probably won't have room for a tiny gavel in the box.)

campaign.story:
We all like our miniatures to look great on the tabletop but decorating bases can be time consuming and expensive. 
From Txarli Factory we want to offer you files to 180 different bases in STL format at incredible price for you to decorate your models easily, and fast.
Here are the 10 starting sets:
You will get all bases pre-supported. 
You can print the tops on flat without the need of supports.
 All bases have been designed to hold 5x1mm magnets.

 Here is an overview of the number of movement trays you will receive:
11x STL files of movement trays for 25mm bases.
11x STL files of movement trays for 32mm bases.
12x STL files of movement trays for 40mm bases.
12x STL files of movement trays for oval bases.
 You can choose the separation between your miniatures:
1/4", 1/2" or 1". 
We want to offer you many blank bases so that you can print the tops that we offer, scale them, and in this way have other sizes of bases that are not contemplated in the initial sets.
The blank bases that we will give you if we unlock this Social Strech Goal will be the following:
- 20mm,  25mm, 27mm, 28mm, 30mm, 32mm, 35mm, 40mm 50mm, 55mm, 60mm, 65mm, 70mm, 80mm, 90mm, 100mm and 120mm.
- Oval 60x35mm, Oval 74x43mm, Oval 90x52mm, Oval 105x70mm, Oval 120x92mm, Oval 170x108mm.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Through our experience in past crowdfunding projects, we are confident about our dates, so the project shouldn't have any issue that could produce a big delay on delivery.
Despite this there are certain variables that can escape our control and as consequence can provoke a delay. For example, last hour additions to the campaign, as new Stretch Goals, can make that the predictet dates can't be accomplished. In any case, we will make regular updates about the state of the project.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 15 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 15 days).
This project is being funded in EUR and any refunds processed will be in EUR for the exact amount received in EUR, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

STL FILES CONDITIONS

STL Files are just for personal use only, you're not allowed to use it for commercial purposes, or gain any kind of profit by it.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active. You agree that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I actually have a container full of little twigs, small pebbles, etc., that I can use in bases, and I sometimes try to make things out of green stuff (I can manage a mushroom as long as it's too small to really look at closely; I am *so* not an artist!) but I would really like a lot of bits I can either glue on or add before I print. If I'm basing a dozen figures on the same or similar types of bases, even one or two slightly different things -- a stick on this one, some mushrooms on that one, a big rock here, a crushed helmet in the grass there -- can make them all look so much different. Things like the rats from that Dungeon base, for instance, would be great additions to a lot of the others. (the city ones in particular)

As I mentioned above, I second (or third, or nth) that comment about stray bits. If we had a plain base in each type, we could attach various bits, or the same ones in different places, to give them a lot more variety. This is a gripe of mine going back to the metal days -- and why I got started doing ornate bases, in fact: You'd get all sorts of different-looking miniatures but they were all on identical bases. That just didn't look right. Having a simple, decorate-your-own base of each type would really be good for that.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick Update on Meeples an Monsters
updates.update_content:
Some folks asked for an update, so here you go! 
We're in that slow-middle part where not much tends to happen other than surprise delays. Thankfully, I have little to report on that front as things seem to be going swimmingly. Files were sent to the printer on May 5th (ahead of schedule) and we're just waiting on the E-proofs - which should arrive next week. After that, probably one more round of E-proofs (which will be much faster), then on to physical proofs which is where the real fun starts because I'll be able to share fun pictures.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update: Late Pledge Closing in two weeks
updates.update_content:
We will be closing the late pledge option in about 2 weeks, so if for some reason you are not a backer and you watch these updates and/or you have friends who might also want a copy (it is a screaming deal), time is running out. After this, all that will be available is the more expensive and not as cool retail version (still a great game though). 
The reason for this is that we have to put in our final quantity order with the printer so they can order the paper/wood we need. That doesn't mean they will start printing next week (I'll let you know when that happens), but it's getting closer. This project really is going along smoothly and I look forward to sharing more news with you and images of the process when I get it.

Perhaps you’re already going back to working and collaborating in the office, or like many of us, you’re hoping that will be a reality soon. (Fingers crossed for 2021!)
Either way, when we return to those days of daily commutes and takeaway coffees, we can’t underestimate the convenience a card holder can bring to our day to day.
But most solutions don’t work well and often don’t last very long.

Carry With Confidence
From left to right, the Orbitkey ID Card Holder Pro and Orbitkey ID Card Holder
Introducing the Orbitkey ID Card Holder System – a durable and sleek card carry solution to help you move effortlessly through your day.
Available in 2 colours (Black and Stone) and 2 models to suit any style and preference.
Friendly Worldwide Shipping – We’ve partnered with warehouses and fulfilment centres across the globe – in the USA, Netherlands, Hong Kong, and Australia. Your rewards will be shipped from your nearest centre.
Press Kit – orbitkey.com/IDC-press
For Press Enquiries – press@orbitkey.com

 Quick and Easy Tap and Go 
The ID Card Holders allow you to easily scan your ID, access or public transport card while you’re on the go.

Reduces the Spread of Germs
Keep your ID or public transport card easily accessible, so you don’t have to rummage through your pocket or bag and avoid touching your other belongings.

Made to Last
The unique swivel belt hook allows the retractor to rotate in the direction you pull the Card Holder in – minimising wear on the retractor cord and creating a truly seamless interaction.
Our custom-made retractor is also more durable and silent compared to standard retractors – made from high-quality materials and built to last for years to come.

Protect Your Privacy
If you’re leaving the office and want to hide your ID, simply pull down and flip your card around. With the built-in privacy feature, the card holder sits within a cavity in the retractor casing and ensures that it doesn’t flip back around – so that your personal details remain personal.

Additional Card Storage
The ID Card Holder has space for an additional non-RFID card for quick and convenient access – perfect for a business or coffee loyalty card.

Wear It Your Way
Can’t clip a retractor to your outfit or prefer not to? Opt for the detachable lanyard so you can wear your Retractable Card Holder around your neck instead. The comfortable woven lanyard also has a breakaway release for added safety and convenience.
Also compatible with other lanyard types. Please note that the privacy feature is not guaranteed when used with swivel hook lanyards.


Extra Storage and Security
The ID Card Holder Pro can hold not 1, but 2 additional RFID cards (such as credit cards and public transport cards) – with RFID blocking technology to protect from digital theft.

Interference-Free Scanning
With the Pro model, you can carry multiple RFID cards and still scan your ID or primary access card without removing it from the card holder.

Hidden Storage for Small Items
The Pro model also has extra storage for small items, such as a key and emergency cash, hidden in a cavity under your ID card.

Dual Orientation Enabled
The ID Card Holder Pro even supports cards in both portrait and landscape orientations. Just transfer the hook from one leather loop to the other.
 Crafted from Durable and Premium Materials 
These features all come together in a sleek and minimal design with high-quality materials – like ethically sourced top grain leather and 100% recycled woven polyester – so you can feel proud, professional and confident with an elegant card holder that you can rely on, day after day.

About Orbitkey
We believe in clever organisation for better living.
Since 2013, we've launched 5 crowdfunding campaigns, with over 42,530 backers, raising over US$2.92 million.
We love Kickstarter. Not only did you help bring Orbitkey to life, you also allow us to focus on making great products and keep doing the things we love – without the influence of outside investors.
We are a team of 22 passionate individuals based in Melbourne, Australia – driven by design, innovation and clever organisation. This new project is the result of continuous feedback and hard work over the past year. We hope to have you join us on our journey towards better living.
Here at Orbitkey, we’ve been taking scalable steps to permanently reduce our carbon emissions, and in April 2020, we became a Climate Neutral Certified Brand!
Climate Neutral is an independent non-profit organisation that provides tools for companies to:
 Measure their carbon footprint through economic modeling;
 Reduce their emissions by developing and implementing carbon reduction plans;
 Offset their emissions if they cannot be immediately reduced by purchasing carbon credits; and
Use the label to empower customers to choose brands that choose to pay for their carbon emissions.
Carbon credits are in turn invested into reducing and capturing carbon dioxide, and can support a range of projects such as forest conservation and renewable energy.
This year, we will ensure that at least 50% of our new products will be made from LWG certified leather and recycled fabric materials. Likewise, 80% of our packaging will be produced from recyclable materials. We will also reduce our air freight shipments company-wide by 40%, and at our headquarters in Melbourne, we will reduce our paper and toner emissions by 60%. But we know that this is only the beginning, and we will continue to improve our processes and further reduce our emissions every year.

Long-lasting design

Sustainable materials

campaign.story:
Cost:  While we would love to offer free shipping, there really is no such thing. Shipping is really expensive and we have tried to come up with pricing that accurately reflects our cost to get the game into your hands without creating a logistical nightmare on our side.  Your shipping will be added in the pledge manager.  We expect that we'll have to come out of pocket a bit based on what we are charging and we are ok with that.
Tracking: We will also be using non-trackable shipments in some cases in order to save on cost as tracking can add 30-50% or more in some cases. So please understand if we do not have tracking with your package we did so knowingly. Rest assured, that we will get you your game and any risk associated with a package not being trackable is on us.
Delivery time: While we would love to get everyone their games at the same time, it is just not possible. There is a high likelihood that some areas of the world will get their games before others. Our commitment is to get the games ready and printed as fast as possible (we've already done a ton of the prep work). 
At the factory we will break out the shipments to each fulfillment company with instructions to them that they should begin shipping as soon as possible upon receipt. In addition, because we have complete control over the U.S. shipments, you will not be able to order and receive the game on Amazon (or from any other US retailer) before our backers have it.   
Please note: Because of unexpected delays and other unforseen issues, we reserve the right to sell the game at major conventions, even if they have not been delivered yet.  The reason for this is that conventions are among the best form of marketing and therefore necessary to give the game the best chance for success.  
One guarantee we will give is that if we do release the KS exclusive version anywhere before the backers receive theirs it will be at a price that is higher (usually significantly) than what was offered in the campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a publisher that has brought more than a dozen games to market thus far, we feel confident in our ability to get this done. The gameplay for this game is 95% complete. The art and graphics are well underway. We are confident that we will hit our release goals with no problems (shipping delays or Acts of God notwithstanding). In addition, our intention is to not release this game to standard retail until all U.S backers orders have been shipped. Our goal is to have it in our backers hands 2-4 weeks before someone can buy it on Amazon.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of our games are made with longevity in mind. We use high-quality components for all of our pieces. Short of losing pieces (which we typically replace for only shipping costs), our games should last you for decades to come.
Sustainable Distribution
All of our fulfillment and logistics are arranged to limit the number of miles/stops each game travels. It's not only better for the world, but it also makes business sense. Based on our previous campaigns, less than 5% of our games come all the way to our warehouse in the US before being shipped back out to other parts of the world.

campaign.story:
We all love the feeling of working at a neat and tidy desk.
But as we get on with our day and mess piles up, so does the clutter in our headspace – making it difficult to stay focused.
But it doesn’t have to be that way.

Transform Your Workspace 
Introducing the Orbitkey Desk Mat – a clever solution to organise and optimise your workspace; helping you stay productive and do your best work everyday.
Available in 2 colours (Black and Stone) and 2 sizes (Medium and Large) to suit any style and space.
Press Kit – orbitkey.com/deskmat-press
For Press Enquiries – press@orbitkey.com

 Create a Clutter-Free Zone 
The Desk Mat creates visual structure in your work area, helping you organise your work tools in a defined space. By being more intentional with what you keep on your desk, the Desk Mat helps to reduce clutter – allowing you to focus on the task at hand, free of unnecessary distractions.

Prevent Paper Pile-Up
Underneath the top layer is a convenient document hideaway for you to store loose papers and notes so they don’t pile up around you – just like sweeping mess under a rug! Keep them out of sight but easily accessible whenever you need a quick refresher or to jot down notes.

Your Work Essentials Organised
With a dedicated space for stationery and small accessories in the toolbar, you’ll always have quick access to your work essentials, whenever you need them.

Cables Kept in Place
The magnetic cable holder can be moved anywhere along the toolbar to keep your cable in place and always within reach. No more tangles or cables falling off the table!

 Stylish and Functional Work Surface
The soft and elegant vegan leather will transform any desk into a warm and comfortable workspace, providing a smooth surface to write on and to use your mouse with ease – suitable for both right and left-handed users.
Feel professional, confident, and in control with a simple addition that can make a huge difference.

Made to Last 
The Orbitkey Desk Mat protects your desk from scratches, stains and spills. The premium vegan leather is exceptionally durable, water-repellent and can be easily wiped clean.
Made to last and ready to take on whatever the day brings, helping you do your best work.
The Orbitkey Desk Mat will help you keep your desk tidy throughout the day – so you’re always organised and ready for the next. 


Each Desk Mat comes with 1 magnetic cable holder. Add additional cable holders to manage multiple cables.
Design Process
We always try to be conscious of what we’re designing – focusing less on the quantity, and more on the quality of a small, but considered selection of products. Our hearts, minds and even weekends were poured into this new product, and here’s a small lookbook to give you an idea of how we went about designing the Orbitkey Desk Mat.
 About Orbitkey 
We believe in clever organisation for better living.
Since 2013, we've launched 4 crowdfunding campaigns, with over 33,000 backers, raising over USD 2 million.
We love Kickstarter. Not only did you help bring Orbitkey to life, you also allow us to focus on making great products and keep doing the things we love – without the influence of outside investors.
We are a team of 21 passionate individuals based in Melbourne, Australia – driven by design, innovation and clever organisation. This new project is the result of continuous feedback and hard work over the past few months. We hope to have you join us on our journey towards better living.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a pretty good track record with our previous 4 campaigns – with most rewards being shipped on time or with a 1-month delay at most. Our previous campaigns have also given us valuable experience in all aspects of bringing a product to life and running a crowdfunding campaign.

It has better prepared us in the challenges associated with tooling, production, logistics, communication, and delivering a high-quality product.

However, there are always challenges and unforeseen obstacles that arise when trying to bring a product to life.

In the case of encountering unavoidable obstacles, we have always handled them swiftly and efficiently, and have always conducted things in the best interest of our backers and Orbitkey family. We always keep our backers updated with complete transparency.

We will do our very best to ensure we deliver what we promise and to go the extra mile whenever possible. Thanks for believing in us!


COVID-19

We're sure that the COVID-19 situation is probably on everyone's mind right now, so we'd like to take this opportunity to update you on how this might affect production.

Our manufacturing partners are back at 100% capacity and have been working closely with us to ensure that everything will progress smoothly, whilst maintaining the highest standard of safety and hygiene.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We've made a commitment that everything we do and build needs to add value and help our community live better lives. If they don’t, we should rethink why we’re doing it, and work out a better approach. Our products are designed with the best materials and built to last – tested thoroughly to withstand heavy use. We love that we're still seeing plenty of backers from our first Kickstarter campaign in 2013 still using the rewards they received then.
Reusability and recyclability
Our products are designed to last. However, should you encounter any problems with any of the parts, you can let us know and we'll be able to send you a specific replacement part.
Sustainable materials
The base of the Desk Mat is made of 100% recycled PET felt. On top of that, all our packaging material is plastic-free and 100% recyclable.
Environmentally friendly factories
All our factories have been carefully selected and are partners we've been working with for several years. We have team members on the ground who visit the factories on a regular basis to ensure quality, ethical and environmental standards are upheld.
Sustainable Distribution
We plan to optimise our shipping routes by utilising sea freight to transport bulk quantities to local warehouses to reduce the carbon footprint of our delivery plan.
Something else
Like Kickstarter, we've already committed to offset our carbon footprint in 2020. We are proud to be a Climate Neutral Certified brand.

updates.update_userinfo: Meet our newest product (+free gift when you back us!)
updates.update_content:
Happy new year everyone... Welcome to 2021!

We're taking a slightly different approach this year after the craziness that engulfed us all in 2020. You can still expect us to push the boundaries when it comes to developing new products, but this year we are committed to be even more focussed on feedback, analysing data and making sure we capture learnings, both internally within our team and also from our customers.

updates.update_userinfo: Desk Mat Inspo + Have your say on how we went!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!

We hope this update finds you all well and safe. Here in Melbourne, we're just coming out of a month's long lockdown so our thoughts go out to those in Europe who are heading into one, as well all our Orbitkey family in other parts of the world who continue to be affected by Covid-19.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update + How to Get Started with Your Desk Mat!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone.

It's been a while since we last updated you so apologies for the radio silence! Bringing new products to life in the age of Covid is a bit of a rollercoaster and our whole team has been working super hard to make sure everything runs smoothly. so please know the lack of news is just us getting the job done!

campaign.story:
Whale Riders is available in English, French, Spanish and Hungarian.
Welcome to Whale Riders - Grail Games' sixth collaboration with designer Reiner Knizia and artist Vincent Dutrait, and our 18th Kickstarter campaign. We hope you may come along for the ride...!
Here at Grail Games, we love what we do, we love great games and we love our fans. To thank our followers for helping us to make some fun board games over the last six years, we have lowered the pledge price for this game as low as it can go. We have subsidised shipping costs as much as we can. We don't want you to miss out on pledging for Whale Riders, because we aren't sure how many copies will make it to retail.
Whale Riders is a new design with a classic feel from famed game designer Reiner Knizia. In 45 minutes of play, 2-6 players will race to the end of the Ice Coast and back, buying and selling as many resources as possible, to make the money needed to acquire the richest prizes. Will you skip opportunities to gain the greatest treasures, or will you make your money slowly along the way?
Each player has two actions per turn, but a lot they will want to accomplish. Sail? Buy? Sell? Draw more order cards? All the while, your opponents might be sailing past and beating you to what's on offer down the coast! Once all the precious pearls have been purchased, the game will end and the player with the most pearls will win!
Each copy of Whale Riders will be carefully planned, prepared and packed. Here is a list of all you will receive. Oh! And please see the Stretch Goals section below for more info on how these components may be further improved and expanded during our campaign...
There are a few different pledge levels for our campaign. In summary, this is what you will receive at each level...
You will be able to choose to receive your game in English/French or Spanish in the Pledge Manager.
Retailers: Before selecting the retailer-only pledge level, please contact us through this link: https://support.murano-alliance.com/retailers to discuss your particular enquiry. Proof of eligibility will be collected via a retailer survey upon completion of the campaign and will need to be submitted before receiving and finalising your pledge manager. Retailers will be able to order a number of copies of each title offered during this campaign.
Whale Riders has simple and short rules, but offers a lot of interaction and interesting decisions for players. It has a classic feel - similar to many of (famed game designer) Knizia’s great designs - but also feels new, sleek and (of course) fun!
→ Watch Stella and Tarrant form Meeple University teach you how to play Whale Riders!
→ You can also download the rule book by clicking the button below!
As well as the board game Whale Riders, we are offering the small card game Whale Riders: The Card Game to backers during this campaign for a low price! Unlike its big sister, The Card Game is not planned to be sold at retail. Copies will only be made available through this (and perhaps a future KS) campaign, and directly through our online store or at a convention. We hope you may consider backing for both games at our ALL ABOARD pledge level.
Whale Riders: The Card Game, 2-4 players will sail alongside each other to buy goods along the Ice Coast. What is on offer at the ports will vary in quantity. Sometimes you will be working together with others only to become competitors again when a better proposition comes along. This is a re-implementation of Reiner Knizia's previously released card game, Trendy.
Just like the Whale Riders board game, the card game is also designed by Reiner Knizia and illustrated by Vincent Dutrait, but it is a much smaller game that plays totally different to the board game…
→ Watch David from Grail Games (and friends) show you how to play Whale Riders!
→ You can also download the rule book by clicking the button below!
With your help, we can make Whale Riders even better! Should we over-fund, we will use the extra funds to improve the game in the following ways (stay tuned to the updates for more info on these upgrades and expansions)...

And please support Whale Riders on social media! With your help we can also unlock the following stretch goals to the benefit of both Whale Riders games...!
What are people saying about Whale Riders?
→ Eric W Martin from BoardGameGeek!
→ Tantrum House!
→ Before you Play!
 → La preview du Labo des Jeux en français (a review in French):
→ Descubre la reseña de Lorena y Napier de Meepletopia (A review in Spanish):
→ Brettspielhero Whale Riders Preview + Gewinnspiel (A review in German):
All backers who pledge $19AUD or more, can add-on as many copies of Whale Riders to their pledge as they would like. Simply hit the "Manage Your Pledge" button and add $19AUD for each extra copy of Whale Riders you need. No extra shipping costs need to be added for additional copies at this time - we will charge you extra shipping costs in our pledge manager once we know the total weight of your shipment. (As an estimate, an extra copy sent to the US will cost $2-5AUD per copy.)
Additional copies of Whale Riders: The Card Game: If you would like additional copies, and you have pledged for at least $13AUD, please add $9AUD to your pledge for each additional copy you need. No extra shipping costs need to be added for additional copies at this time - we will charge you extra shipping costs in our pledge manager once we know the total weight of your shipment. 
Some other Grail Games titles may be made available during our post-campaign pledge manager. Stay tuned for more info as that time approaches.
More about Yellow & Yangtze: Yellow & Yangtze: (also from Grail Games, Reiner Knizia and Vincent Dutrait), is the sister game to the classic Tigris & Euphrates. It is for 2-4 players and takes about 90 minutes to play. In it, you will replay an eventful period in world history and strive to lead your dynasty to dominance.
Please note: Backers will select the English or French edition in our pledge manager, bad sadly, Spanish is not available during this campaign.
For more info on the game, including images and video reviews, please visit the game on our website or on BoardGameGeek.
Kickstarter will automatically add the following shipping costs to your pledge when you select it. (Please note that the costs below are in AUD, but will be converted to your "home" currency when your account is charged should we fund.)
If you wish to add a second (or third) game to a single-game pledge, we may need to charge you a few extra dollars to cover your shipment's increased weight. This will occur in our post-campaign pledge manager.
If you add-on extra Grail Games titles with our post-campaign pledge manager, the shipping cost for those games will be calculated at that time.
We have done our best to keep these shipping costs as low as possible. And, to reduce taxes and fees, games will ship to backers from within the USA, Canada, Europe, and Australia*!
*Australian and NZ backers have the option of paying extra to receive their copies of the game earlier - posted directly from China (and not from within Australia 1-2 months later). If you would like to take this offer, back at the regular shipping level now, and we will give you the option to pay extra in our pledge manager after the campaign. (Note that the 6-pack is not available for express shipping as the package will be overweight).
By supporting Whale Riders on Kickstarter, not only are you helping us to produce the game(s) in the first place, but if you back now, you will also receive them:
at a cheaper than MSRP price,
with Whale Riders: The Card Game (if you wish), also heavily discounted and only available through Kickstarter and directly through Grail Games,
earlier than anyone else will get the games, and,
we will be providing copies of some other titles to backers of this campaign at a reduced price as a thank you to you (Yellow & Yangtze and others via our post-campaign pledge manager)!
But that's not all…
The Whale Riders titles were designed by well-known designer Reiner Knizia (of Lost Cities, Pickomino, Medici, Yellow & Yangtze fame, and much much more). He knows how to make a small game fire on all cylinders!
The Whale Riders titles are easy to learn games that are approachable and can be played by almost anyone.
The production files are ready to be uploaded to the printer right after the campaign is successfully funded. We will do all we can to deliver on time!
The games are full of beautiful illustrations by fan-favourite illustrator Vincent Dutrait.
Countless hours have gone into the design and development of this game to ensure a balanced and enjoyable experience.
We are committed to fulfilling all Kickstarter pledges before they are available at retail. And on that point: We appreciate the support of game stores and see them as an essential part of our hobby. However, in today's crowded marketplace, our titles are becoming harder and harder to find by customers. Whale Riders will appear in stores, but at this stage, we don't believe it will be widely available. Your best bet is to back now (and at our super-low price - MSRP will be $30USD+) should you want to be sure of owning the game.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Designer - Reiner Knizia
Dr. Reiner Knizia is one of the world’s most successful and prolific game designers. More than 600 of his games and books have been published worldwide in over 50 languages and have won him numerous international awards.

Artist - Vincent Dutrait
Vincent Dutrait is currently one of the most highly regarded illustrators of board and card games in the world. His use of traditional illustration methods and media, as well as his bright style and attention to detail have earned him worldwide praise.
  Publisher - Grail Games
Remake it better!
Grail Games is a card and board game publishing studio located in Sydney, Australia.
Founded over six years ago, we have already run 14 successful Kickstarter campaigns. We focus on reprints, and producing English language versions of great games from Asia and Europe. Sometimes, a mid-weight game just proves itself to be so good that we must try to publish it - Whale Riders was one of these cases.

Grail Games’ aim is to produce board and card games that are:
Fast to teach: our games have clean, straight-forward rules sets to decrease the number of barriers to entry.
Replayable: Games blossom when they offer a variety of pathways to explore. All of our games have a high Game Play Depth to Box Size ratio.
If you would like to find out more about us or our games, please visit www.grailgames.com.au
Please click on the buttons below to follow us on social media :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Grail Games has already successfully funded fourteen games, all currently available in game stores around the world. Since our first Kickstarter campaign was received EARLY by backers in January 2015, we have continued to send high quality products to backers on time! We have our systems well in place and use a top manufacturer to produce and ship quality games around the world. Grail Games is beginning to forge a track record of delivering fun games with quality components… on time!
However, unforeseen circumstances can hold up a project. This can happen at the point of manufacture or during shipment. Grail Games has given a time-frame for delivery of the Whale Riders games that we believe is certainly achievable. If anything does affect the project, backers will be kept in the loop via regular backer updates at every step of the production and shipment process.
Note that the currency conversions in the pledge level blurbs are a guide only. Currency values may fluctuate during the campaign.
Also note: Backers will receive the game at the best possible price and will receive their games before retail stores, but Grail Games cannot guarantee that retailers will not sell the Whale Riders games at a cheaper price than Kickstarter supporters will “pay,” especially months or years in the future.
Finally, Grail Games will happily send replacement parts of any game damaged in shipment or due to manufacturing mishaps to backers, etc., but if backers fail to inform Grail Games of a change in shipping address or similar, backers may be asked to pay extra costs if they require a replacement copy of the game.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It is going to be one of those games that spawns debates about what to do from a hopeless position. If you’re a “play for the win only” kind of player who’s bothered by the type of kingmaking that occurs when a player playing for position / personal score improvement runs into a scenario where they either can pass and maintain their current position / score or trigger an end-game where they with certainty will not win but will improve their position, I expect this game will drive you nuts. Theoretically nobody but the eventual winner should be ending the game, but that just begs the question of what a player clearly unable to win should do. Knizia does this a lot with his player-controlled endgame conditions, but I get the feeling it’s going to bother more people than usual here given the “race” framing of the game. (Won’t bother me personally, I love this kind of stuff.)

campaign.story:
Steven Universe: Beach-a-Palooza Card Battling Game is a game FOR Steven Universe fans BY Steven Universe fans! And we need your support!
Like most of you, our world has been turned upside down by the coronavirus pandemic. Though work on this officially licensed game is 100% finished and approved by Cartoon Network, our release plan was disrupted and there will be NO FORMAL RETAIL RELEASE. So, we are coming directly to you, the passionate Steven Universe fans out there!
Backing Steven Universe: Beach-a-Palooza Card Battling Game on Kickstarter is the ONLY way to get it . . . the game is a KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE. So spread the word and let’s do this together!
Thanks for your support and see you at Beach-a-Palooza!
At this year’s Beach-a-Palooza, Steven has a surefire way to win: Recruit more Stevens from the timeline and have them all front their own bands!
This is your chance to become a Steven and try to put together the best band and audience! But it’s not going to be easy: Party Crashers—Corrupted and Homeworld Gems—want to ruin your amazing performance. It’s Beach City’s event of the year and you’re on center stage. Play your cards right and your band might be the big winner!
We expect the game to start shipping at the end of 2020 or in early 2021. It is English-only and we're shipping worldwide in partnership with Quartermaster Logistics. This game is "friendly" in terms of shipping (i.e., no customs/import taxes) to the US, Canada, EU/UK, Australia, and New Zealand.
Shipping rates are based on actual costs to ship your rewards (depending on your country) and will be charged as part of your pledge.
Please note: Due to COVID-19, most shippers have added surcharges to their rates. The amount we charge for shipping reflects the latest rates. In some regions, the cost of shipping may exceed the cost of the tier you’re pledging for; unfortunately, this cannot be avoided. In most cases, pledging for two games (“Double Up” Tier) costs the same in terms of shipping as pledging for one game.
Due to COVID-19, all schedules need to be considered somewhat tentative this year, as there have been and will continue to be unexpected delays worldwide. However, we do have a planned timeline for getting you your games, barring disruptions: 
 August: go to print
 Mid-/late-October: ships leave port with games
 Thanksgiving weekend: ships arrive at destination ports for distribution
 December 2020-early 2021: fulfillment
Check out the Steven Universe: Beach-a-Palooza Giveaway! By checking it out and spreading the word, you can enter our awesome Giveaway! We are giving out 50 of the below Steven Universe Trading Cards prizes to Winners! Contest open to residents of the U.S. and Canada only. Must be 13 years of age or older to participate.
By entering the Giveaway, you also have the chance to be a Daily Prize Winner! We will announce up to 4 Winners via the Cryptozoic Twitter account every afternoon, July 20-30. Each Daily Prize Winner will receive a NYCC Convention Pack, which includes a hand-drawn Sketch Card, 3 Chase Cards, and Promo Card CE1. The first 24 Daily Prize winners will also receive a Bubbled Gem Totally Fabricated Card.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not our first rodeo! Cryptozoic has run several Kickstarters in the past, and we have learned a lot. We know fans invest not only their funds but their time in supporting Kickstarter campaigns. We take your commitment very seriously, and in return we are determined to provide you the very best game possible. The game is completely done and files are ready to print. However, even in normal times, delays can happen due to unexpected issues, such as shipping container delays, factory issues, bad weather, and more. These are clearly NOT normal times due to the COVID-19 pandemic, making any projected timelines uncertain. You have our word that we will do our best to mitigate delays and communicate about them to all the backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

To any developers that would like to answer, what was the most difficult part of creating this game? What was the biggest challenge, whether it be fairness, incorporating all you could, etc.?

When working with licensed games the hardest and most exciting thing is ensuring that the fans feel like Steven Universe has been given all the love it deserves AND still have to be a really fun game. I think there has been a strange assumption that all licensed games are reskins of existing games. This one was built as a SU game from the very beginning. There are SOOOOOOO many references build into the cards. Some of the harder parts have been trying to get people to pay attention to the game. We have had people say it's just screen shots from episodes (it's not) that it was some game turned into SU (it was certainly not). This game was completely designed for fans but it is the fans who we also have to convince that this isn't someone trying to mess with their beloved IP. SU is very special in my house. Even both of my sons absolutely love the show. When play testing this game it was important to test with as many fans and non-fans a like to ensure that not only was the game fun for both but if they were fans that it felt as SU as possible. And if they were not fans, it was important that they still could understand the logic of the world and just have fun playing the game. I can't tell you how many people that I got to play this then went and bingewatched the entire series. It's been magical. Misson accomplished ;)

campaign.story:
I am an independent game designer and publisher.  You can see some of my games and prototypes at www.GearLockGames.com. When I tell people that I design board games, they immediately ask questions about the design process. This is because they have an idea for the game, but they are not sure where to start.  After helping several people though this process, I decided to publish a book that covers the basic steps.
You will find that there are not a lot of books out there that just simply walk you through the steps on how to create a board game.  This book aims to remedy that issue.  In this book, you will find detailed information how to flush out your game idea, create a prototype, playtest the prototype to develop the game and finally how to get the game printed and out into the world.
The book also covers some basics on finding a publisher, self-publishing and how to use Kickstarter to fund your game.
*New to the 4th Edition*
The 4th Edition provides step-by-step instructions on how to upload and play your game on Tabletop Simulator (TTS) and Tabletopia. They are both virtual board game environments that allow you and others to play the prototype of your game together. This is perfect for playtesting and a great way to pitch your game to publishers and reviewers without having to create expensive, physical copies of your game. Tabletopia has a free and paid version for board game designers. TTS has a cost but also has the advantage of helping you create engaging videos of your game. Each of the tiers and features are covered in the book.
About the Author:
Avid board gamer with a personal collection of over 400+ games.
Independent board game designer and publisher.  Owner of Gearlock Games.
Created over 20+ board game and card game prototypes.
Successfully Kickstarted several small board game projects: Barn Raiser, En Passant and The Elements: Duel
Masters in Adult Education (M.Ed.) frombthe University of Central Oklahoma
Published several books that have sold over 15,000 copies (including books on other topics)

Printing your Prototypes
Using Tabletopia and Tabletop Simulator to Upload, Pitch and Test Your Game *new* 
Group Playtesting
Pitching to Publishers
Blind Playtesting
Self-Publishing Basics
Kickstarter Basics
Kickstarter Video Basics
Rules Guide Recommendations
Shipping Basics
Mass Manufacturing Options
Lessons Learned

campaign.story:
It's a simple problem that is extremely common in our hobby, so common that I think most everyone just overlooks it.  We've made a simple solution!
Board Game Clips holding together Formula D
Have you ever been playing your favorite multi-board board game and someone knocks one of the boards out of place? Or you just can't get them lined up perfectly during setup? This can be extremely frustrating! These little clips will solve these issues and are designed specifically for board games! 
  How Board Game Clips Work
Board Game Clips are a simple, affordable solution to a simple issue.
They will snugly and temporarily clip together two boards or keep seams in boards closed with very minimal intrusion into the play surface and without noticeably marking or scuffing your board.
Board Game Clip helping to keep Terraforming Mars board completely flush!
 
        These fit nearly all board games such as Cyclades, Formula D, Zombicide, War of the Ring; Or any other board with thickness from 1.75mm to 2.5mm. These have rounded edges so they won't scratch your boards and are created with a continuous bead of 3d printed filament on each layer so that they are very durable and will hold their shape and tension for many hundreds or thousands of clips and unclips. I will also ship an extra clip with each order just in case one does break!
Our clips have been engineered to remain usable for thousands of clips and un-clips! PLA plastic is created from corn, cassava, sugarcane or sugar beet pulp.
 
        While not quite big or strong enough to straighten badly warped boards, these will solve the issue of slightly warped boards! Simply put them at the seams of the boards to keep things flatter!
  Rewards and Add-ons
 Base Pledge Levels 
There are 3 base pledge levels:  Personal, Large, and Collection.  Early in the campaign, I realized this product was very popular and I found a way to provide less expensive shipping to much of the world so I created the OUTSIDE USA pledge levels for international backers, please use those if you are not in the USA.  All of the pledge levels include an equal number of the two standard variations of straight 2mm clips.
Board Game Clips helping a slightly warped Twilight Struggle board and keeping together War of the Ring! Also a shot of 8 clips you will get with a personal size order.
The narrow variation have a little more "bite" in their grip and don't intrude into the playing surface quite as much, the wider version won't squeeze your board quite as tightly but has a larger compression area, both provide roughly the same result and I find myself using both equally in different situations.  These clips are made for boards 1.8mm - 2.7mm thick and work great for nearly all games!
    Add-ons
Straight 2mm clips won't work for every game or in every situation obviously, so we have also developed some additional "special" clips which are available by over-pledging (adding additional money to your base pledge).  At the end of the Kickstarter campaign, I will be emailing everyone a backer survey where I will ask how many of each type of additional clip you over-pledged for.  Below is the cost of adding special clips to your order.  The cost per clip varies based on which pledge level you backed.
If you want to purchase any of these special clips, please follow the below instructions:
1- Use the chart below to determine how much additional money to add to your pledge.
2- Update your pledge to include this additional amount.
3- When the campaign ends I will send everyone a reward survey, this will include questions asking how many (and what type of) special clips you purchased.  Please answer these and we will send out the correct amounts to you!  You can ask to receive any of the special clips in any combination you choose.
Below are descriptions of all of the special clips available for addition to your pledge.  All of these clips have been designed with the same principles in mind of functionality, durability, ease of use, flexible application, and leaving as little impact on your boards as possible!
    90° Corner Clip
90° Corner Clip holding together Game of Thrones the board game and it's expansion pieces.
By far the most requested special clip has been corner clips.  As you can see in the picture above from "A game of Thrones" these clips will come in handy in MANY different situations, it's so nice to have things stay put and look cohesive throughout the entire play session!  These clips will work for boards of 1.75mm - 2.25mm which covers almost anything you can throw at them!
    120° Hex Tile Clip  (2.5mm)
One of the hottest new games out right now is "Rallyman GT" it's a great game but wow are those hex tiles difficult to play on!  I've created these 120 degree clips specifically for this purpose!  Any other game that uses hexagonal tiles with 2.25mm- 2.75mm thickness will work great with this also, if you have another game in mind please let me know, I would love to hear about it!
120° clips holding together Rallyman GT!
    3mm Straight Clip
With all the high-level productions being put out by publishers lately, many games are coming with dual-layered boards, most of these dual-layered boards are 3mm thick in total, these clips will hold these together and keep things in place.  These will work on any board from 2.8mm - 3.25mm thick.  I've heard from a backer that Barrage could benefit from these.
Testing the 3mm straight clips on a typical dual-layered board.
    1.5mm Straight Clip
Some games just don't measure up!  Ok... maybe that's harsh, but plenty of great games have slightly thinner than "standard" boards.  Any board that is 1.35mm-1.8mm will probably benefit greatly from these clips, as these are the types of boards that warp easiest.
    120° Hex Tile Clip  (2mm)
Same as the 120° 2.5mm clips, but for games that use hex tiles that are 2mm in thickness.  I don't have any examples but I'm assuming they exist!  =)

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
These have rounded edges so they won't scratch your boards and are created with a continuous bead of 3d printed filament on each layer so that they are very durable and will last for many hundreds or thousands of clips and unclips.
Sustainable materials
We print these clips with PLA plastic, made from renewable resources such as corn starch or sugar cane, it's a natural polymer designed to substitute widely used petroleum-based plastics like PET. While more expensive than other plastics, it has amazing mechanical properties and is environmentally friendly.

updates.update_userinfo: All orders (without issues) have been shipped! Now circling back to "problem" orders
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, thank you again so much for your patience!  I just have a quick update for everyone.  I'm very happy to say that over the weekend we have finally finished shipping out all of the orders that had no exceptions with them.  We are about four months later than expected, but very excited to be at this important milestone towards completing fulfillment.  Most everyone has their clips now and I'm so happy to hear from everyone, on a near-daily basis, how they are using and enjoying them.  Thank you all!

We are now circling back to address all of the orders that had problems in their backer survey and respond to all the emails that have been piling up over the last few weeks that we've missed.

Hi all!  I hope everyone is doing great and everyone who has their clips are enjoying them.  I'm so happy whenever I see a note from someone saying how their Board Game Clips have improved their gaming experience.
We are nearing the end of fulfillment, albeit quite a bit later than anticipated.  Currently, we are finishing up the last 70 USA collection size orders, we hope to have these completed by the end of next week.  We are then going to complete the international collection size orders which look like they will be finished by the end of September, or very close to it.  I apologize for the delays, we are nearly there though!

Thank you to everyone for your continued patience.  I wanted to get everyone the latest information on our shipping progress.  
personal and large orders outside of the USA are seeing very large delays in some cases.  Many people may notice their package shows as "delivered" in the USA, this is simply a sorting facility that the post office uses for our package classification.  After this point, it seems that most packages have been going completely dark with tracking but they are eventually getting delivered.  I spoke with the postmaster at our post office regarding this, he says that he has seen delays of over 3 months in some cases.  This is due to the fact that there are basically no flights from the USA to Europe currently, so there are very few planes for mail and packages to get on to.  They are making their way over, but it is a MUCH slower process than normal and some packages just get physically buried under the backlog of things waiting to get onto overseas transportation for months at a time.  For this reason, I won't be investigating individual international packages for many months to come.  Many people have already contacted me individually with these concerns, I've told them this same information and the package has shown up for them.  So I'm asking international customers to please be patient, your package will more than likely arrive, and if it doesn't, we will address it together later this year.  This is just the reality of the current shipping situation with the pandemic and is obviously completely out of my control.

I just logged in here to collect the next batch of orders and noticed there are a LOT of people who have received their orders and are enjoying their clips which are awesome!!  However, there are also a lot of comments asking for the status of their orders, and I really need to be packing orders not answering people individually.  So I wanted to try and hopefully clear up some of the questions and let everyone know where we are with shipping:
Completed Orders

Hey all, I just wanted to send out a quick update on shipping.  We ran into a snag with the first batch of ~400 international large orders we packaged up and printed labels for.  I noticed that some addresses were entered incorrectly and I need to go through each of the labels to try and correct as many as possible.
If any of you have received a shipping notice and see the address being wrong please PM me so I can correct this if I haven't already.  Things have been delayed for about 8 days now, but I will be shipping these out in the next couple of days.

updates.update_content:
We're very excited to start fulfilling all of these orders!  We have about 800 orders printed and we are beginning to go through the survey responses, cleaning up the data some, contacting some people about under pledges and putting together the addresses for import to our shipping software!  The first batches of shipments will be in the mail later this week.
Things are going a little bit slower than we had hoped, we've had an explosion of business with our insert sets that we are obligated to meet deadlines for on Etsy & Amazon, we've since pushed back the promise dates on those sites and we're finally caught up there.  The new printers we ordered to cover the demand are delayed due to manufacturing and shipping delays and we've run into issues getting reliable shipments of quality filament right now due to shortages at various places.  We're working our way through the issues though and it looks like the worst of the shipping bottlenecks has been resolved so hopefully it's smooth sailing going forward!  I will definitely not be meeting end of May delivery for all customers though, assuming most everyone will see their clips by the end of June.

This Kickstarter campaign has been a blessing to our family and we're so grateful to all of you for your support!  We're so excited to start the shipping process on these clips and getting them in your hands.  I really can't wait for the day when I see some of these being used at a convention and I can thank you personally!  God bless you all.
As I stated in our last update, I ordered two more printers to fulfill these orders as quickly as I can.  We've printed about 15,000 clips in the past month and we hope to print and ship another 40,000 by the end of May which should get us through all of our orders if everything goes as planned.  I am noticing some hiccups in the availability of printers and plastic, hopefully this trend doesn't get any worse!  We have a basement full of packing supplies and clips and we're just about ready to go on the first batches of shipments.
