campaign.story:
Indictus [unspeakable] is the first volume in a series of deluxe dark art poker playing card decks. A sophisticated and highly thematic deck that take inspiration from the tragedy of Macbeth by William Shakespeare, The Tudors and the history of human ethics.
The deck illustrates the damaging physical and psychological effects of political ambition on those who seek to gain power through activities related to the underworld and dark faith. Furthermore, Indictus is a visual depiction of deception, ethical treachery and shadowy immoral shortcuts. Get off your moral high horse and start double-dealing.
Monumental design that doesn't reveal itself as a deck of playing cards at first glance. You have to turn it to see the minimalistic pips in the layout. The two editions walk the same path to some extend, but I really want them to part ways in the finish by the use of unique embossing, foil and finish.
Click to see high resolution album
For the Pristine edition my aim is to have it come across as a restoration of the original, antique Indictus deck. A re-make with beautiful, yet delicate updates to the tuck pattern. 
Monarch's orb on left side and pentagram on right side of tuck
Click to see high resolution album
                                                        The Antique edition is meant to appear as the original, heavily weathered Indictus deck of the Late Middle Ages. There's plenty of wear and tear in the design to make a really interesting embossing for this one. My aim is to have you feel the weathered condition of the tuck.
Monarch's orb on left side and pentagram on right side of tuck
Click to see the online album in HD
                       Golden metallic ink accents utilised for the two-way and highly detailed designs, with microscopic differences in the layout to set them apart. There's a lot of spiritual and iconic symbolism going on here. Twisting in and out you'll locate royal scepters, orbs, pentagrams and a double headed snake finding its way towards the crown. Most noticeable you have the white and black borders between the two.
The decks are essentially identical when it comes to the number cards, courts and aces, only with minor cosmetic deviations in appearance. Displayed here below is a mix between the two decks for optimised comparison.

The indictus court cards are represented by 4 'hands', 4 queens and 4 kings. They are all in a perfectly aligned two-way design and accompanied by old latin phrases (that all start with an 'A').
Click on image to inspect the cards in high resolution
Card faces are clean and have rich ink application for the Pristine edition. For the Antique edition the faces are all the same, except for the weathered feel that has the black ink slightly faded. The 'dirt' layer on these cards is also in a two-way design, so no odd surprises there.
The illustrations are drawn in hand by Marksbart, but modified and converted to appropriate line art by me, so I can’t take full credit for these. What I can do, though, is relay all positive comments to him and pay him for his talent - which I already did!
FREE matching boxes are added to your rewards if you pledge for 6 or 12 decks. Both the half brick (6 decks) and the full brick (12 decks) are represented in the two editions, Pristine and Antique. The ornaments and details will be as close to the foil gold as humanly possible within the limitations of CMYK manufacturing. 
Want an all exclusive, one-of, box with your name implemented to the box design? You can have that by grabbing the SUPREME or ULTIMATE pledge tier.
The Jokers are identical for the two editions, so you are not missing out on any of the symbolic imagery. What do you think the deck is trying to say here?
Here's also a great opportunity to feel the delicate differences of the face cards between the two editions. Which one is your favourite?
Soft to the touch, the branded satin pouches are ideal for the storing of your Indictus decks or to be used as exclusive gift packaging. The deluxe satin pouches are manufactured in black and have gold foil icons hot stamped to represent the theme and style.
No additional shipping costs involved for this add-on
The pouches are manufactured specifically to hold one deck of poker sized playing cards. Grab two pouches to your pledge for great savings. Though it might seem odd to protect your worn Antique edition deck from further dust and scratches you have to admit that it really takes it to another level. 
Your choice of pouch version will be settled when project has ended
Signature specifications are settled in the project survey
I'll be signing and dating the decks with a white sharpie either on the intact cellophane or on the tuck itself (after removing the cellophane). The choice is yours, and I'll just lead the pen to where you want it to go. Also, if you don't want all your decks signed just let me know.

Indictus will only be made with your support to help cover the costs of setup fees, proof charges, printing, design, freight, shipping and the time to create the 54 original pieces of art. I am launching this deck on Kickstarter as an artist, a cardist, and an active fan of the crowdfunding concept. Let's do this together and create something unique!

Then, as global postal service conditions have settled back to normal conditions I am going to start my fulfillment. This should allow all parcels to ship and transit without much hassle during January. If everything goes according to plan the decks should be well delivered to all backers by mid February. In other words I've made a plan with buffers and some wiggle room.

Presented artwork is subject to minor tweaks and updates, inspired by backer feedback and comments. Constructive criticism and feedback is very much appreciated as I love sparring on design.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not my first kickstarter and I know how things work.
All presented features have been technically confirmed, and formally quoted by NPCC prior to launching this kickstarter.

I've spent several months researching, designing and budgetting. However, obstacles can arise unexpectedly. Potential set-backs include production delays, shipping and sourcing issues. That being said, I feel extremely confident in my tested suppliers and the conservative timeline I've chosen. Buffers are added to the development plan because I'd love to deliver all rewards as promised, if not before.

As an experienced graphic designer, I've brought many complex products to my audience on time and with great feedback. There's nothing more important for me than getting your rewards delivered on time and as advertised.

I have a long and extremely positive track record with the shipping company, Deutsche Post/DHL. However, 'force majeure' events do happen from time to time and this project budget does not allow expensive ensurance contracts in relation to unsuccesful shipping.

Please note that customs MAY carefully open your deck(s) during shipping and thus break the factory sealing/cellophane. These are standard procedure checks to make sure that the parcel contains what it says. This project budget does not allow me to replace any such inspected decks with a new ones, and I hope for your understanding in such event. I am not to be held responsible for damaged, lost, unclaimed, opened or destroyed parcels. Shipping is handled with Deutsche Post and sent without tracking ID.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear backer of Indictus

There's a good change that you already heard these news via my Dominus project, but I just wanted to make sure that all my supporters got the news that volume III in my Light versus Darkness series, Culminus, has now launched on Kickstarter.

Culminus Playing Cards was funded in 6 hours and reached 3 stretch goals in 48 hours with the help from more than 400 backers!

Dear backer of Indictus

Thanks for all the positive and encouraging comments in my inbox!

I've been counting the uncut sheets I have left from this project, and I still have 5 of each edition left. I could be offering these in my new and current deck project Dominus, but I think it's only fair and logic to present them to you first.

Dear backer

I am happy to say that Dominus has now launched on Kickstarter!
This is the result of 6 months of hard, but enjoyable, work from my hand.
It was an absolute pleasure to do some sparring with you all!
Finally I can reveal the project to the whole world and I so so happy with how it came out. You can see it for yourself right by clicking any of these images:

Dear backer of Indictus
Well that worked well! 
An awesome deck became a reality, all thanks to your support, and I couldn't be more motivated to continue the theme with volume II. The funding exceeded my best hopes and expectations, resulting in the unlocking of a staggering 10 Stretch Goals! The result of it all is now in your hands and I am still receiving messages from people who missed the project.

Dear backer
I really appreciate your comments on the projects page. Not only have I been looking forward to seing your reactions when you got the decks, but it also helps me to gain more insight on the average transit timelines of international shipping for the various continents.

Dear backer
The time is 8AM and I am having my first cup of coffee as I write this. I've shipped about 350 unique parcels at this point, and I'll get back to work right after I've finished this status Update.
My first priority was the ULTIMATE and SUPREME pledge tiers, which are now fully taken care of. Some of the higher pledge tiers are as time consuming as they are honorable. From this point on I should be able to ship even more parcels by each day, so if you haven't received your reward yet it should be in transit somewhere next week.

Dear backer
Fulfillment of your Indictus rewards has started!
I've made arrangements with the Design Imperator fulfillment team to speed up the process of my fulfillment. This is going to result in a faster processing, better packaging and more efficient international shipping, so it is an obvious choice for me really. Nothing is more important to me than to live up to my responsibilities as project creator.

Dear backer!

Here's an Update to keep you in the loop with the status of the Indictus decks.

I've been requesting some insight on the shipping status and the reasons for it's delays. I got my reply today and will relay it here, assuming that you share my interest and impatience just as much.

The Indictus decks are currently located at the border between Poland and the Ukraine, where they are finally scheduled for clearance next Monday.

Apparently the customs procedure and formal paperwork between the Ukraine and the EU has become significantly more complex than what it once was. This is a heads-up if you are a project creator yourself.

Rest assured that the fulfilment of Indictus is my primary concern and getting the decks out to you as soon as possible is my main objective. Both NPCC and I are focused on the task of having the decks cleared and delivered as swiftly as possible. Gosh, I've been ready for this phase for almost a full month by now, aha.

With the fulfilment phase commencing very soon, I'd like to reassure you that the shipping of your rewards will be handled with much care and passion to ensure safe travels. I am a passionate backer myself.

Another Update will be posted as soon as I have any news.
Enjoy your weekend!

Warm regards
Nicolai Aarøe

Dear backer of Indictus

As I’ve now inspected both Indictus tucks first hand I am pleased to say that these decks live up to my high expectations, and I have to applaud NPCC for a job well done.

campaign.story:
Vermillion Lies was a band made of two strange sisters and sometimes a bunch of our strange friends. We recorded albums and toured the world from 2006-2009. 
We broke up in St. Petersburg, Russia in May 2009.
Then we got drunk on No.9 beer. 
Then we didn't talk to each other for four years. 
Two years ago we met in a field in Austin, Texas and ate some tacos and got along. We remembered all the wonderful things about each other and kept talking and hanging out. 
Last month we asked you if you would be interested in some new Vermillion Lies material. You said "YES!!!"
This April we met in New Orleans, Louisiana and started to write and record some new songs. We sang together real nice. We played guitar, synthesizer, and weird percussion. We made up some sick dance moves.
We're ready to put these songs down on some sort of recording medium. And we're wondering how many of them you would like. So...
We're asking for $3,000 per song. That means we can pay a studio and we each get a tiny bit of money to live on. We'll record up to ten songs together. If we make more money we'll just make everything fancier and pay rent for longer. 
We like making songs. 
We like lobsters. 
We like power clashing. 
We like you.
 .
Video shot by Alix Angelis
Couch photo by Greg App

campaign.story:
One Hit Kill is a brand-new card game in which players race to construct weapons that can knock out their opponents in a single blow. (A One Hit Kill.) It draws from traditional card games like gin and poker, along with European-style games like Catan and Ticket to Ride. We classify it as mid-Atlantic.
One Hit Kill is easy to learn and fast-moving: no hit points, no mana, no need to consult the rulebook. Its simple rules allow for surprisingly complex strategy. We’ve playtested it with ages 8 to 78. Everyone quickly gets it, experienced gamers and newbies alike. 
The game was created by John August and the team that brought you Writer Emergency Pack, with illustrations by amazing artists who’ve worked on top fantasy games. 
To get the game first. We'll be shipping One Hit Kill to Kickstarter backers in September. This may be your only chance to get the game in 2015.
To shape the future of OHK. From Magic to Munchkin, great games evolve based on their early players. With expansion packs, forums and Maker's Kits, we want you to help chart the course for One Hit Kill.
To support Kickstarter projects that ship. We're the same team that created Writer Emergency Pack, which shipped months early to the delight of backers. Here's a selection of what they wrote:
We think One Hit Kill might become your new favorite game, so please help us make it a reality.
Thanks!
A game of One Hit Kill usually takes about 10 minutes, so you can squeeze in a few rounds at lunch — but it’s also perfect for game nights with friends.
We recruited 30 players of all levels to try out an early build. Here’s what they wrote afterwards:
We had an amazing experience launching Writer Emergency Pack on Kickstarter last year. For a few months, it was the most-backed card project in Kickstarter history. That momentum let us scale up in ways that would have been impossible otherwise. This year Writer Emergency Pack will be in 2,000 classrooms, 50 countries and several major retailers, including Amazon. 
One Hit Kill is a very different project, larger in scope in several ways. 
For starters, we’re bringing in amazing artists to illustrate 82 cards. We also have a vision for the future. In addition to the core game, we’d love to release expansion packs on a regular schedule so the game can continue to grow and evolve. 
Some of our first expansion packs may include Pirates & Zombies, Lovecraft & Austen, and Apocalyptacular! Each one changes the game in exciting ways, opening new strategies and keeping the game fresh. 
In order to offer expansions, we need a sizable base of players from the start. That's why our future goals are based on backers, not dollars:
                     And something brand new:
You can make these goals happen by hitting achievements. Some couldn't be easier.
Our Facebook page loves Likes: facebook.com/onehitkillgame
Our Twitter feed will reward your following: @onehitkillgame
For Vine videos, you can use #onehitkill and #portaltonowhere hashtags to mark them. Also link to them in the comments or on Facebook. 
For SoundCloud songs, you can use #onehitkill and #anthem hashtags to mark them. And again, link to them in the comments or on Facebook.
John August came up with the game and the rules. (His daughter came up with the name.) He’s written seven movies including Big Fish, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Frankenweenie. He’s the co-host of the Scriptnotes podcast, creator of Writer Emergency Pack, and surprisingly good at Labyrinthspiel. 
Dustin Bocks illustrated all of the Component cards, and created the class icons. He knows an astonishing amount about the Harry Potter universe. 
Noah Bradley is well-known for his illustrations for Magic: The Gathering and many other fantasy games. You can find information about his upcoming project The Sin of Man on his website, along with articles and videos for aspiring artists.
Matthew Chilelli composed the amazing music for our video. He has punched fewer than two grizzly bears.
Simon Estrada is an illustrator and character designer who has worked on projects for Hasbro, Saban and The Jim Henson company. For us, he designed the Scriptnotes tour shirt and a yet-to-be-released animated short. You can find his portfolio at his site.
Stuart Friedel is a master playtester and shipping ninja. His father, Lee, is a dentist. 
Christina Hess works as an illustrator and designer in the publishing industry. Her successful Kickstarter project “Animals from History” is a collection of stories that spin over twenty historically-charged fictional tales. You can see more of her artwork on her site.
Ryan Nelson designed Writer Emergency Pack and the Weapon cards for OHK. He helped create our Highland and Weekend Read apps, and develops videogames on his own. He is a cool breeze in July.
Nima Yousefi makes apps, including the OHK apps. He loves genre TV shows and cute animal videos. 
Thanks!
Please follow us on Facebook and Twitter or we’ll have to play this card:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The game works. We’ve printed sample decks and playtested it with a bunch of strangers of all backgrounds and experience levels. We know it’s fun. 

We have our artists on board. They’re amazing, and we have a schedule for getting stuff done. 

We also know how to print things. We’ve made and shipped 18,000 Writer Emergency Packs, using printers both in the U.S. and China. 

Despite our best planning, problems may still arise: printing delays, Kaiju monsters, gamma ray bursts that knock civilization back to the Stone Age. But short of global catastrophe, we should be okay. We've built in contingencies for budget and schedule that should get us through. 

There's a chance we won't reach our funding goal. That would be a bummer. We would reevaluate and figure out how to do this better. 

There's the chance the response could be so large that we are overwhelmed with orders. We’ve been talking a lot with our friends at Exploding Kittens about their experience, and will benefit from everything they’ve learned. 

Bottom line: If stuff comes up, we'll fix it, and we will tell you. You're backing this project because you want cool things. We want you to have them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
With all Kickstarter rewards for One Hit Kill shipped, we’ve started selling the game on our store: onehitkillgame.com
So if you want to pick up extra copies for family and friends -- or a Maker’s Kit for yourself -- now's your chance.
Through December 18th, you can use the special discount code KRAKEN to save $5 on any order.
Backers across the U.S. and around the world are starting to receive their copies of One Hit Kill. It’s been exciting to see the game showing up in forums, comments and hashtags around the internet.

Last week, we began shipping One Hit Kill to our 1,951 backers.
The game is already starting to arrive:

If you live in the western half of the United States, look up, because your copy of One Hit Kill might be flying above you right now.
I just got confirmation from the air freight carrier that all four pallets of the game made it onto the plane from China. They’re on their way to the expediter, who will get them through customs, then load them on a truck to be hauled to our shipping partner in Philadelphia.
From there, big boxes have to be broken into smaller boxes, and then put into other boxes so they can be shipped to your doorstep.
Next week, we’ll be sending out the backer survey for One Hit Kill. We’ll be asking for your shipping address, because the game is printed and boxed and almost ready to go:

After many weeks of planning and prototyping and proof-reading, One Hit Kill is being printed right now by our partners in China.
We’re using the production team who just finished Exploding Kittens, so they have quite a bit of experience printing and boxing a bazillion cards. The quality is fantastic. I can’t wait to show you these decks.
Since our last update, we’ve tweaked some colors, revamped some icons, and finalized new artwork. I wanted to give you a glimpse of what’s new.

updates.update_userinfo: Getting the instructions right, plus new art
updates.update_content:
Instructions are tricky, even for things that seem really simple.
Let’s say you had to explain to someone how to make scrambled eggs.
If you were standing beside them at the stove, you’d just show them. Easy and obvious. But if you had to write it down, you’d quickly realize how difficult it can be to describe actions and states and outcomes. “Step 17: When eggs are glossy but not runny, turn off the heat.”

campaign.story:
Salem is a strategic card game of deception, built for 4-12 Players. It is most suited for players aged 12-93. Estimated game time is 25-35 minutes.
GAME CONTENTS
1 Faux Book Container
111 Cards (15 Town Hall, 36 Tryal, 59 Playing, 1 Moderator Script)
1 Thirty-second Hourglass
1 Instruction Manual (Includes character biographies)
14 Circle Tokens
WELCOME TO SALEM
Who needs a game closet? Hide Salem on your bookshelf.
The year is 1692, and it is a perilous time to live in the town of Salem, Massachusetts. One wrong step, or one misplaced accusation, and you could be the next witch to hang. "Salem" takes players into this perilous world and lets them re-live the tension, politics, and religious extremism that still has people talking about it 300 years later.
The game is packaged in a faux book box that closes magnetically. The game, disguised as a worn out leather book, can easily hide on your bookshelf and masquerade as an antique.
Players can play as prominent villagers from the old Salem town, and even read their bios in the instruction manual. The servant girl Mary Warren, pastor Samuel Parris, farmer John Proctor, storyteller Tituba, and beggar Sarah Good are some of the 12 characters featured in the game.
Players, each acting as one of these unique characters, are given 3-5 Tryal cards (depending on the number of players). These Tryal cards reveal the true identity of each player, "Witch" or "Not a Witch."
During gameplay, players gather cards that they use to accuse, or defend, other players. Deciding who to trust is key to survival, since you can never play a card on yourself. When you suspect someone to be a witch, you can begin accusing them with red accusation cards. When enough accusations have been placed on one of the players, the player who lays the final accusation chooses one of that player's Tryal cards to reveal. Once all "Witch" Tryal cards have been found, the villagers of Salem win.
Players can also use green and blue cards such as "Alibi", "Stocks", "Matchmaker", "Asylum", and "Scapegoat" to help or hurt their allies or enemies.
As players draw cards, they will eventually draw black cards that take immediate effect. One black card, "Night", forces all players to close their eyes while the Witches choose someone to eliminate and the Constable chooses someone to potentially save. The other black card, "Conspiracy," forces all players to take a face-down Tryal card from the player to their left. Killing witches quickly is essential, otherwise "Conspiracy" may soon have the whole town turned evil.
Before long, accusations will be flying, and screams of "She's a WITCH!" will wake the neighbors. Will you be the hero who purges your town of witches, or will you be wrongly accused and hung for witchcraft? Or perhaps you will be a witch yourself, escape conviction, and bring Salem to the ground.
THE GAME
TOWN HALL CARDS
All cards are top-quality 310gsm ivory core (premium)
TRYAL CARDS (note the old spelling)
PLAYING CARDS
FAUX BOOK, HOURGLASS
Faux Book is the game container and closes magnetically.
 TESTIMONIALS
"Salem is an awesome group game and never gets old! Every game you assume different roles, and with the design of the game, things are constantly changing. Right when you think you know who the witches are, cards start getting passed around. The game Salem requires strategy and teamwork. You will really get to know your friends." -Jayson Jensen, Computer Guy
"Salem has just the right amount of challenge so that it makes you think and strategize at how to win. Anyone who likes Mafia or games that involve moderately sized groups of people playing to the death will love this game! It's a great game to play with a good group of friends at a party or after dinner. Super fun and I totally recommend it!!" -Mary Nichols, Music Major
"Your friends may become your enemies, your enemies may become your friends, but you can never be sure. Besides being a ton of fun to play, Salem is also a visually stunning game which sets it apart from other mystery games. I give it 5 stars.” -Ben Nielsen, Social Media Guru
"What an incredible game! I want to play it over and over again because each game presents new and exciting challenges. I love that it accommodates a small group of friends in addition to a big crowd which makes it perfect for any event. Once the game is over, you won't be able to stop talking about it." -Whitney Jensen, School Teacher

HOW TO PLAY
Rules Note: Full instructions and further clarifications are included in the Game's instruction manual. Of our hundreds of play-testers, each felt that the game was very easy to learn and each felt quite knowledgable of the rules after their first game.
Moderator Note: Since we hit our $55K stretch goal, tokens have been added to each game, allowing for each game to be played with, or without a Moderator.
 GAMEPLAY DEMO
 Demo Note: Here we show 4 players, although up to 12 players can play. The demo does not show the use of tokens, since these were recently added as a stretch goal to better accommodate games without a Moderator. The tokens do not change gameplay.
The video may not show this clearly, but at the beginning of the game the witches see who each other are when the Black Cat is played. They also see each other when they eliminate someone during the Night. A big part of the witches' advantage and deception comes from their extra knowledge about who everyone is. 
Tokens are used in the Night rounds to indicate who was killed, and who was saved.
Strategies: The townspeople try to find the witches based on how people are acting (some people are good liars, some people are not!), how people are treating each other (since the witches have a secret alliance with each other), who people are playing cards on, whether witches themselves choose to confess after the Night, etc. Players can also analyze who was given the black cat and who was killed during the night and why. Also, since the first law of Salem says that you can never play a card on yourself, the only way to play the game is with allies. You can't win the game without trusting someone else. So a lot of the game is about you individually choosing who to place your trust in. 
There's also an element of the shell game involved- if I am a witch, would I put my witch card closest to my neighbor or near the middle? Did I move the Tryal card I got from Conspiracy to a new location in front of me or keep it in the same spot? Where should I put my Witch card so that my neighbor will be most likely to grab it during Conspiracy and join me as a witch? 
There's also an element of deck management. If everyone holds on to their cards, then when the deck runs out and the discard pile gets re-shuffled, Night and Conspiracy are going to happen again very soon, since the new deck is so small. It's in the townspeople's best interest to move quickly. It's in the witches' best interest to run through the deck and hold on to their cards.
In Mafia/Werewolves the only data points you have are how people are acting. In Salem, you have more data points to go off of, since you can analyze how people are acting, and what cards they are playing on who. There's also a hint of logic with tracking the Tryal cards as they move around the circle. As a person's Tryal cards get revealed, and they keep coming up "Not a Witch", they develop a stronger and stronger alibi and become a less desirable target.
Feel like we missed something? Check the "Nitty Gritties" section in the FAQs below. The Nitty Gritties section will be included in the rulebook, and should settle any disputes.
Looking for some advanced rules? This is also in the FAQ. It contains ideas for making the game more challenging, and tips for being sneaky with token-placement when you don't have a moderator.
Want to read the moderator script? It's in the FAQ.

SALEM INSPIRATION
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and great design.
1. Mechanics
Growing up, I always loved playing "Mafia" at family reunions. It was the best kind of game- one that involved reading other people and hiding your own role from people who knew you very well. It was a challenge. Over time I grew frustrated over several aspects of the mafia game. There wasn't an official structure to the game, the game always required a moderator, someone always had to die right at the beginning, rounds could drag on forever, there was no way to partially accuse someone, etc. Salem aims to right these wrongs while still bringing forth a new game that captures the essence of the Mafia spirit. 
We have also enjoyed games such as "Bang", "Ticket to Ride", "Betrayal at House on the Hill", and "Werewolf" and have brought the best parts of each of these games into "Salem," while also adding completely new game mechanics. Every round of play-testing led to more and more tweaking, adding, and eliminating. We're very happy with the end result.
2. Theme
Halloween has always been my favorite holiday. Something about the theatricality and intent to frighten just seems to heighten the stakes. We felt that the Salem Witch Trials captures this feeling perfectly. The old Protestant strictness, the spooky northeast, and a cast of characters that has been studied and been made larger than life through pop culture take this game beyond the mechanics and into the imagination. 
For whatever reason, "witch hunting" has become a common phrase in our everyday life, in news stories, and in politics. We felt that using the most famous example of witch hunting would naturally lend itself to a game like this one. The accusations, defenses, and instinct of self-preservation that can be found in the history of Salem seemed to be the perfect setting for our game.
3. Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and the graphic design from Holly will take you into the world of Salem, just as a piece of literature, music, or film would do. We used a lot of browns and textures, to make it feel like entering a world of dirt roads, wooden churches, and town squares. 
Note the crosshatch design patterns on the bonnet and dress.
For the characters and card illustrations, Sarah employed a crosshatch method to give the characters dimension while still retaining the texture consistent with the game. In the graphic design, Holly used Old-Style fonts, reimagined the city seal of Salem, and used a 17th century quilting pattern across many of the card backgrounds.

updates.update_content:
Salem Backers and Friends,
It has now been 5 years since we launched Salem on Kickstarter. Since that time we have published 5 games and sold over 150,000 copies around the world. It is because of you as our original Salem backers that we were able to start making games full time. When pledges started coming in on that first day, it was a moment that truly changed our lives. We will forever be grateful to you as the first people who believed in us! Thank you.

Backers and Friends,
We’re happy to announce that just minutes ago we launched our third game! The game takes place in the old west where you’ll need to work with your team to gather the most gold-filled Safes. But beware, some of your teammates may be plotting to shoot you in the back! We think it will fit right in with Salem :) You can access the campaign here: Deadwood 1876

Backers and Friends,
Our new game, Tortuga 1667, just barely went live on Kickstarter! We wanted to tell you first so that if you’re interested in the game you can get a discount as an early-bird backer.
Here is the link to the project: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/travishancock/tortuga-1667-a-pirate-game-of-mutiny-plunder-and-d

updates.update_content:
Backers and Friends,
We hope that life is treating you well!
Since arriving on shelves last year, Salem has now sold over 10,000 copies all over the world! It continues to pick up steam and grow its community of players. All of this was possible because of you, so we thank you once again.

Backers and Friends,
It's so exciting for us to finally get Salem into many of your hands! Hearing about your experiences playing the game has been incredibly rewarding.
All games have either arrived, or are nearing arrival. Every day we have people getting the game all over the world. If you are still waiting on a game we very much appreciate your patience and we believe that it will arrive soon. Please message me if you have any concerns, or would like a specific update on your package.

Backers and Friends,
We've had a busy week! We were thrilled to receive Salem in our warehouse, and have spent most of the week packing everything up and sending it out. Several hundred US orders went out today, and the majority of the US games will go out on Monday. Your games are on the way!
Our fulfillment company in Hong Kong is working hard to get all international orders out over the next few days. Please be patient, as some of these international orders may take a little longer to reach you.

Backers and Friends,
Great news! Salem is on its way!
USA Backers:
The game has cleared customs in Los Angeles, and is now on its way to our warehouse in Utah. It should arrive here next week on Tuesday or Wednesday, at which time we will ship the games off to you as soon as possible.

Backers and Friends,
Great news! Salem is currently on a boat, making its way to us from our factory in China. We'll receive the games here in early November, and then have them shipped out to you as soon as possible after that. International orders will be trucked to Hong Kong this week, and will be shipped in a couple of weeks.
If you've changed addresses in the last few months, or will be moving in the next few weeks, this is one of your last chances to update your address. Just go to  and enter your Kickstarter email, and you'll be re-sent the survey.

Backer & Friends,
Great news! Mass production & printing of SALEM is now complete! We received a copy of the final game from our factory, and we're thrilled with how it looks.
Our factory will spend the next 2 weeks assembling all of the games and preparing pallets for shipping. After that, shipping will take about 4 weeks which puts us right on track for a November delivery date.

Backers and Friends,
Just wanted to share some great news with you. Our factory received the faux books, and has sent us proofs for all printing and manufactured pieces. We've now given them our approval to begin mass production. We couldn't be more thrilled with how things look and feel! 
We're still looking great to hit our November delivery goal! Enjoy some pictures of the print proofs, the "white copy" (to check the size and quality of materials), and one of the manufactured books.

The history of art commissions is the history of wealthy people paying artists to make something about wealthy people, or big institutions paying artists to make something about everybody else.
In 2015, we think that there’s a different way to do this — one in which anyone can contribute to a commission, to make art about everyone who contributes to it.
So this Kickstarter is the collective commission, not just to fund the work, but to become part of it. 
One pledge gets you four works of art, each produced with your data. 
In June, the artists will release four new works of art generated by this campaign's backers. This art show will be made available on the Internet, on Electric Objects' EO1, and at a real world event. 
200% of the funds will go directly to the artists. *
Because Electric Objects believes in supporting the creation of new art, we will match every dollar that's pledged to this campaign.
*up to $2,000. (We need to save some of our budget to fund other art projects @ Electric Objects.)

Good news everyone: We're launching The $5 Commission online next week!
On August 17th, The $5 Commission artworks will go live on the web. Addie, Casey, Lauren and James used your answers to the backer survey to create four original works of art.

updates.update_content:
We did it! We are now over 1,000 backers, almost $7,000 in pledges and counting!
With a little over an hour to go we wanted to take this time to say a big thank you for supporting The $5 Commission. Our goal was to make commissioning art more accessible to more people, and we’re humbled to see so many of you get behind this project.

With 700 backers, over $4,500 raised, and less than 24 hours to go, we decided it's time to up the ante.
So here's the deal: If we reach 1,000 backers by the end of this campaign, we will give one lucky backer a free EO1 in June!

Wow! We're really humbled that over 500 of you have backed The $5 Commission in just 24 hours. We have now raised over $3,300 to fund the creation of new work (660%+ funded)! Thank you to all the backers and friends who are helping to make this project a reality.

Add-ons: To add-on extra copies of Best Treehouse Ever, simply multiply the pledge level + shipping by the number of copies you'd like when finalizing your pledge!  
FUNDED! All 9 Stretch Goals Unlocked! (See below)
Have you ever dreamed of building a super awesome treehouse? Now it’s time to live that dream! In Best Treehouse Ever, players compete to build the best treehouse in the neighborhood. Players will outfit their treehouse with the coolest rooms, all while making sure their tree doesn't tip over…and that their rooms are the most impressive at the end of the game. Building takes place over three weeks/rounds, and at the end of the third week the winner will be the player with the best treehouse ever! 
Image enlarged to show detail.
Each round, players use card drafting and spatial reasoning to add 5 new rooms to their treehouse. Players must pay attention to the other treehouses being built since they will take turns determining which types of rooms score for everyone at the end of each round.
Game set-up for a 4 player game at the beginning of Round 2.
Best Treehouse Ever is small box card game that appeals to a wide audience. This game will satisfy gamers and families looking for a quick, easy-to-teach experience that provides player interaction on every turn.
Best Treehouse Ever is a game for 2 to 4 players, ages 10 and up and plays in about 20-30 minutes. The game is designed by Scott Almes (Tiny Epic Kingdom, Tiny Epic Defenders, Tiny Epic Galaxies, Harbour, Kings of Air and Steam, and Martian Dice).
Here's a super fun stop-motion how-to-play video from Stikfa-mations by Greg Cornell:
 And check out this how-to-play video from Rich Mullholland's Treehouse in South Africa:
 Kickstarter Promo Pack Contents:
Click images below for full content!
Click the image to see Rahdo's Runthrough!
"There's a little story that's being told. You really feel a nice sense of accomplishment. And it's very different and unique." -Richard Ham, Rahdo Runs Through
"What really makes the game, though, is the scoring. Although you can use the scoring rules for younger players, I think the Game Changers are what really make the game fascinating and they add a nice strategic element to the game beyond just finding the best place to put rooms...this is another cute game that’ll be fun for both your kids and your adult gamer friends. Even if you don’t win, you’ll have fun putting together a crazy treehouse anyway." -Jonathan Liu, Geek Dad
"The cool thing with this game is not only does it look good, it plays good. For me, I feel that it appeals to a wide spectrum." -David Taylor, To The Table
"Drafting is one of my favorite mechanics, Scott Almes is one of my favorite small game designers, and Green Couch Games is slowly becoming one of my favorite publishers. Put them all together and you have Best Treehouse Ever - a light, family friendly card game that fully immerses you in its quick and charming game play. It has quickly supplanted Sushi Go as our family’s drafting game of choice. Don’t miss a chance to fulfill a childhood dream! If you’re a fan of fun, I highly recommend you check out Best Treehouse Ever." -Dan, League of Nonsensical Gamers
"Best Treehouse Ever is an easy pitch for anyone who likes enjoyable filler games, a nice spatial puzzle, and who has a little bit of imagination leftover from their childhood. One step above others in its grade, Best Treehouse Ever makes simple drafting enjoyable by forcing quick and easy, but still meaningful decisions about card placement and scoring bonuses. The total package blends together to make a vibrant and heartfelt game that is difficult to play just once." -Buns, League of Nonsensical Gamers
Listen to Green Couch Games founder, Jason Kotarski interviewed on the League of Nonsensical Gamers Podcast here!
       "Overall, Best Treehouse Ever may very well be one of the best fillers to come out since 2013’s Sushi Go!. It has that “classic card game filler feel” of No Thanks, Bucket King, Coloretto, For Sale, and of course Sushi Go. Not only does it have like classic feel vibe, but it has the same brightly colored art and light theme as some of those as well, adding all the more to that “classic filler feel.” " -Ryan Sanders, The Inquisitive Meeple
You can also read Ryan's interview with designer, Scott Almes here!
"Best Treehouse Ever is a nice little step up from Sushi Go: lots of drafting, with some nice scoring strategy thrown in. It's got a great learning curve, streamlined mechanics, and it packs a lot of fun into a great theme! I'm a big fan!" -Jeremiah Isely, Theology of Games
"As the kids get older and family time gets crunched, short and fun filler games become more and more valuable. Best Treehouse Ever fits the bill. I have no idea how much longer my kids will love this game. But they do so love it. So I do, too." -Scott Firestone, Theology of Games
" I feel the game is a great game for the first or last of the night or while waiting for another group to finish. I also see it being a huge hit with families." - Ken Grazier, Geek-Craft
"Best Treehouse Ever is a fantastic, lightweight family game. It’s easy to teach, fun to play and at the end you are left with a feeling of accomplishment. You’ve actually built a treehouse right in front of your eyes!" -Brandon Kempf, What Did You Play Last Week Podcast Thing (listen to the podcast here!)
"This game is great! We all absolutely loved it. We were able to squeeze in a game while packing up our house to get in ready to sell and still felt we had a fun." -D. Eric Ortega, Board Domination
Read Board Domination's interview with Scott Almes about Best Treehouse Ever here.
                                              Listen to Jason and Andy from the 20 Minutes of Filler Podcast chat with Scott Almes here!
"I've played the prototype of this game and it is AMAZING! Light, but thoughtful and (of course) looks outstanding!" -David Palomares, BGG User
"Best Treehouse Ever! - an amazing card drafting game...Seriously, look at that art and try not to grin like an eight-year-old at a toy store. I feel like Phineas and Ferb when I play this!" -Chris Leder, game designer of Roll For It! and Trainmaker
More info and reviews available at BoardGameGeek.com
As we get closer to our funding goal, we'll be announcing some sweet STRETCH GOALS to keep the party going. We have plans to add value to Best Treehouse Ever that we think you will really appreciate. We plan to add value by upgrading components, including more great art, and increasing replayability with added game content.
We have several stretch goals in mind and we hope to hit them all! But know that just as with our first campaign for Fidelitas, we won't likely be adding more just to add more. We believe that more isn't always better, especially if it holds up production and delays delivery.
That being said, we'll be listening closely to your feedback and ideas and will carefully consider all the ideas that comes our way.
UNLOCKED! Adding linen finish to the game cards gives a great tactile dimension and polished look to the product making your Treehouse just a wee bit fancier! We shot past our funding goal to $16,500! Upgrade activated!
UNLOCKED! These Bonus Cards add a new layer to gameplay! Intended as a variant, hidden goal cards will provide a new challenge and lots of extra replayability when adding this 6 cards mini-expansion to every copy of Best Treehouse Ever.
UNLOCKED! We get to put the talents of Adam McIver to work once again to add more rooms to the Treehouse! 12 additional rooms will add more of the fantastic art that helps make this game so special. Instead of 24 unique rooms and 3 copies of each in the deck, we'll be looking at 36 rooms with only 2 copies of each. 
UNLOCKED! We will upgrade 4 of the wooden octagon tokens to custom acorn meeples to use for the Balance Markers! Everybody likes custom wooden bits, right? These little things will add a whole new level of cuteness/thematic integration to the game components.
UNLOCKED! Advanced Bonus Cards! These add yet another small twist on the gameplay of our little game; 6 new cards but you get more points for building them higher in the tree! These cards will be delivered in a plastic sleeve outside the box and will not be included in the retail version of the game. They may become available later on at conventions and online, Kickstarter backers get them first!
UNLOCKED! At $37,500 every Treehouse Room in the game will be unique! That's double the amount of cards currently in the game. 72 rooms of Treehouse fun! 
UNLOCKED! 4 more cards added to the promo pack (available first to our awesome backers before anybody else) will open up new scoring possibilities! For this variant, players will be able to choose from 2 additional Game Changer Cards (2 copies of each will be included) types; 1 that will allow a player with the least amount of a specific room type to be the only player to score that type, and another that allows a player with the most of a room type to be the only one to score it.
It would be nice if the kids actually had a way to get into the treehouse! Adam will spend some time adding ladder illustrations to the Starting Tree Cards! Each ladder will match one of the player colors!
UNLOCKED! These are going to be cool! And we're working on a couple different ways to use them! They'll be included in the Promo Pack with the Advanced Bonus Cards and Advanced Game Changers that will only be available to Kickstarter backers at first!
If you've checked out the videos and read the reviews and still want more info, you can check out the Rules PDF RIGHT HERE! 
The rules are hosted on BoardGameGeek and will require a free account to download. But if you like games, BGG is the place to be so head over there now to get plugged into the world-wide gaming community! 
If you've read the rules and are still on the fence please check out free the Print & Play version of Best Treehouse Ever! This way, you can try the game out and if you like the experience then come on back to pledge for a full production copy! 
We believe in this game and know that if you give it a chance you'll see the love and attention we've put into developing it for game tables around the world. So get on board and give it a go! See for yourself if Best Treehouse Ever is for you. 
Best Treehouse Ever is available world-wide and all copies will ship from within the US! Shipping fees will be added to your pledge level when you select your home location.
Added Shipping: US-$3, CA-$9, Everywhere Else-$12
Note: International Backers will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package. However, this campaign is CUSTOMS FRIENDLY. The low price point and small box for this game should not cause any customs fees for backers pledging for 1-2 copies. We have learned that shipping is a costly endeavor and we must try to keep our costs as low as possible to keep our games at an appropriate price point for when they hit retail. We are saying THANK YOU to our early adopters on Kickstarter by offering the game at a price below MSRP ($20) and adding some extra content at no extra charge (when we reach STRETCH GOALS, of course).
 Scott Almes is the designer of the successful Tiny Epic series (Gamelyn Games), as well as other hits such as Harbour, Martian Dice, and Kings of Air and Steam. He currently lives in Pittsburgh with his wonderful wife Beth. He hopes you enjoy playing "Best Treehouse Ever" as much as he did building it, and that it helps bring out the kid in everyone.
Adam McIver is a gamer, artist, and game designer from Chicago. His art and graphic design can be seen in projects from Crash Games, Dice Hate Me Games, Eagle-Gryphon Games, Tasty Minstrel Games, and more. His game Coin Age from Tasty Minstrel Games is a precursor of more greatness to come. In 2014, Adam launched into the gaming industry full time with his new company, The Cre8tive Dept. 
Green Couch Games is a new company founded by Jason Kotarski to release great little games that make great big connections like our first title Fidelitas, a game of medieval meddling. Jason is also a game designer and co-host of 20 Minutes of Filler, a Dice Tower Network podcast. 
We know that you have lots of games to choose from and there aren't enough ways that we can express our gratitude to all of our supporters. It's backers like you that are helping to make this new company a reality. It's backers like you that are bringing this dream to life. And for that, we say thanks. We hope you enjoy the little games that we contribute to the gaming community that we love so much!
Thanks for your pledge and for helping us spread the word! Sharing about the project on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Reddit, and other networks you are a part of goes a long way!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My experience with our first campaign, Fidelitas, a game of medieval meddling, provided quite the learning curve. And so far I have been able to avoid delays and common pitfalls by paying special attention to the following areas and building on previous experience:

Art and Design. The art and design for the game is well on it's way to completion so we'll be ready to print shortly after the close of the campaign. I wanted to show you I mean business by paying for the art and design upfront!

Playtesting and Reviewing. Best Treehouse Ever has been tested by many different groups and has been played at Unpub. I have sent out more than 30 prototypes to reviewers around the world. I want to earn your trust by providing you with a solid product that has been thoroughly tested and reviewed by folks from varying backgrounds and perspectives.

Past Experience. This is only the second Kickstarter project I've run for Green Couch Games but I have helped with several other successful campaigns. Also, having spent many years working in retail and customer service, I understand the importance of treating backers with respect and following through with projects.

Of course, there are always unexpected circumstances that pop up, but I PROMISE to communicate every step of the way and do my best to use creative problem solving meet the challenges head on.

Thank you so much for giving Green Couch Games a chance. As a small company, I truly can't do this without you. I will do my best to thank you by creating great little games that you love to play.

Sincerely, 
Jason Kotarski, founder of Green Couch Games

To simplify, when you are choosing your scoring card, you must not only consider how many points that card will give you and your opponents, but you must ALSO consider how many points everybody is likely to get from the choices OTHER people make. No point in choosing the card I have the most of if somebody else will choose it, anyway. The last person in the order, has perfect information about what everybody else will choose, because they have already chosen it. The first person has to GUESS what everybody else will choose when trying to make the optimal decision. I'd suggest either using the same method used for determining order for the Game Changer cards (with the oldest, then the highest scorer in later rounds, choosing first) or else somehow make everybody choose simultaneously and secretly, and if their choices overlap, that means less colors get scored that round.

I'd agree that it makes no difference IF all the colors were being scored, but they aren't. The last person to choose has all the information they need to make the GUARANTEED best choice for them. The first person to choose might have to decide if perhaps they should choose a color that they have less of, but which nobody else has very many of either (since it might NOT be chosen by anybody else) and guess that their BEST color WILL be chosen by somebody else, since others have significant amounts of that color...or should they choose their best color to avoid the risk that nobody else will choose it? I can tell you, even our 7 and 9 year olds could tell that it made a difference what order people chose in, because those later in the order had better information about what others would do. In fact, the result of our game ended up hinging on the order, I think, because a player earlier in the order felt like they needed to hedge their bets, since they didn't know what everyone else would choose. Had they chosen differently, it WOULD have made OTHERS choose differently, and the result would have been different.

campaign.story:
The creators of numerous successful Kickstarters, including Four Tribes, Dig Down Dwarf, and Of Dungeons Deep!, bring you a new and exciting game that uses dice to actually build trains!
In Trainmaker, you will step back in time to the Old West to roll the custom-molded railroad dice and begin building a train to meet the needs of the available Station Cards. Every train has to start with an engine and a train car. Will you take it easy and make a small train, or push your luck and reroll the dice to build a mighty train? Choose carefully, because if you can’t add to your train after rolling or finish the train with a caboose, you derail, and your turn ends! More details in the Overview Section.
Trainmaker is designed by Chris Leder, who is quickly moving up the ranks in the industry with his hit game Roll For It! by Calliope Games and his upcoming City of Gears by Arcane Wonders. 
Why Pledge Now?
Discount - By backing Trainmaker you will get your copy at a nice discount. The MSRP for Trainmaker will be $25, plus you are getting a $7 shipping credit (Free Shipping within the U.S.). That means that by pledging now, you will save more than 35%.  
Backers First - We have made it a priority in the past, and will continue to in the future, to ship games to backers before we open up sales to the public. It is only fair that those that helped make the game happen get their copies first!    
Your Feedback - We value your thoughts and ideas. Honestly it is what keeps us coming back to Kickstarter. Getting customer input before manufacturing is an invaluable asset to us!  
Stretch Rewards - By backing Trainmaker you will actually affect the outcome of the final game. The more we raise, the more that can be approved or added. See the "Stretch Goals" section for more details.  
We Simply Need You - Your continued support will allow us to pay for a large print run of what we feel is a fantastic product and help us ship it all over the world.
Trainmaker will now be manufactured by Panda GM. Panda GM is the industry standard in board game manufacturing. Our choice to use them is a direct reflection of my desire to make Trainmaker the absolute best it can be. 
 If we fund, we promise that Trainmaker will be a thrilling and rewarding experience for you and your family and friends. However, if we overfund, we will be able to expand the game in both quality and quantity. You see, the more we raise, the more units we will be able to manufacture. This equates to a lower unit cost. These savings WILL be added back into the game in the form of additional content and better-quality components. Below are these additional goals and rewards:
All Aboard is a quick solo game designed by Chris Leder. It is played with the train meeples and dice from the game. Chris is known for his one card game designs as he had a successful one released with Roll For It! last year.
Lawmen vs Robbers is a two-player game designed by Jonathan Gilmour, the designer behind the hit Dead of Winter. It plays a bit like Liars Dice, but with each player in the role of either Lawman or Robber. Each having their own distinct powers. Will include 2 all new role cards with all new artwork.
This will include a nice linen finish on the box itself.
Rail Tycoon is a 2-5 player game designed by Stephen Avery, the designer behind the hit Nothing Personal. In Rail Tycoon players will use almost all of the games components in a new way. This is a dice driven and card melding good time! Will include 5 all new tycoon cards with all new artwork.
7 Custom-Molded Dice
40 Station Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
12 Contract Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
6 Custom Train Engine Meeples Unlocked!
2 Reference Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
2 Piece Setup Box
BONUS All Aboard Mini Game designed by Chris Leder!
Instructions 
Trainmaker will mark the second game in our Small Box Series, with the Award-winning Dig Down Dwarf as the first. Our goal is build up a nice library of smaller games with a variety of mechanics and themes that all play big!
Trainmaker is a 2-6 player game that takes roughly 20-30 minutes to play and is enjoyed by players ages 8 and up.
The object of the game is to collect either one of each station type, or to complete your hidden contract. The first player to do so declares victory!
At the beginning of play, each player receives two random Contract Cards. They choose one and then discard the other from the game. This contract is the player's hidden objective for the game and is a separate and secret route to victory.
Then the game begins as players take turns rolling dice in an attempt to secure Station Cards.
Players may go after additional Station Cards on their turn if they are willing to begin a train with two engines instead of one! If they do so, and take a Station Card, they can re-roll all the dice used to create that train and go after another Station Card. It is possible to clear the table of all three available Station Cards on one turn if you are lucky and take a few risks!
Lastly, many of the station cards offer the player "Discard Powers". A player may discard an owned Station Card during their own turn to invoke a special "one time" power like re-rolling all their dice, or setting a die to a particular side. These powers offer the player a way to take further risks and make more choices during play in order to win.

What is the Outlaws Expansion?
The Outlaws expansion introduces 3 bandits to the Station Cards deck. These jerks spend a round robbing players of one of their dice if they happen to roll the train car the outlaw wants to rob! But to counter this, 6 new Station Cards are added and each has the passive U.S. Marshal ability to protect the player from the bandits. The bandits are smart enough to move on to easier prey.

The cost of shipping Trainmaker is factored into the pledge levels for U.S. Backers. I wanted to explain the shipping costs to everyone, so that you can see exactly where the numbers came from. Below is a nice chart that shows the dollar amount you need to add to your pledge depending on where you live and the shipping credit that is applied at each level. Whatever the cost is to ship within the U.S. becomes a credit that is applied to Canadian and International shipping. Example: It costs $7 to ship one copy of the game within the U.S. and it costs $15 to ship the same package to Canada, so $7 is taken off the cost for Canadian Backers, thus you only have to pay $8 and not the full $15.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our goal is to make a quality product and we understand the challenges of doing so. Our focus is to stay engaged with both our manufacturers and backers to keep everyone on the same page and informed. An informed backer is a happy backer.

If challenges arise, we will hit them head on. Sometimes an issue can cause a delay, and while delays are typically avoided, producing the the best product is always our end goal. Again, open communication with our backers is key.

All fulfillment will be done in house via the use of USPS. We have our quotes from manufacturers in hand and all artwork is close to complete.

We also have experience with Kickstarter, having run 7 successful campaigns for Plague The Card Game, Zogar's Gaze, Tasnia, Neptune, Four Tribes, Dig Down Dwarf, and Of Dungeons Deep! We feel that this experience gives us a good advantage if and when any issues arise.

All of our previous projects have been shipped to backers with the exception of Of Dungeons Deep!, which is not due until late spring/early summer. Of the six projects we have delivered, four were early or on time, and only two had a minor delay. Again, we always keep an open line of communication with our backers.

campaign.story:
UPDATE 3-6-15 --> EVERY COPY OF THE DAGON OBELISK SLIPCASED EDITION NOW COMES WITH A FREE KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE "THE THING BELOW" PRINT!
UPDATE 3-6-15 --> EVERY COPY OF THE DAGON BOOK NOW COMES WITH A FREE KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE BOOKMARK!
UPDATE 2-11-15 --> THE DAGON BOOK HAS BEEN UPGRADED 50% FROM 48 TO 72 PAGES!
UPDATE 2-11-15 --> EVERY COPY OF THE DAGON BOOK NOW COMES WITH A FREE H.P. LOVECRAFT PORTRAIT PRINT!
DAGON is a short story written by H.P. Lovecraft in July 1917 and one of his earliest published works. The story is the testament of a tortured, morphine-addicted man who plans to commit suicide over an incident that occurred early on in World War I when he was a merchant marine officer. It's an amazingly powerful and visceral story whose concepts and creatures directly connect to Lovecraft’s later and far more famous Cthulhu works.
DAGON will be adapted and drawn by Ben Templesmith, New York Times best selling comic book artist who is Co-Creator of 30 DAYS OF NIGHT with Steve Niles and FELL with Warren Ellis, as well as Creator of WORMWOOD: GENTLEMAN CORPSE, THE SQUIDDER, and WELCOME TO HOXFORD. This story has preoccupied and haunted Ben since he first read it 20 plus years ago, a time before he’d published any of his own work or knew that he ever would.
DAGON will be a limited run 8.5x12" 48 page (BOOK NOW UPGRADED TO 72 PAGES) hardcover graphic novel. We're also offering a slipcased "OBELISK" edition of DAGON that we think is going to be awesome! The OBELISK edition includes:
an exclusive book cover
an exclusive slipcase cover
embossed, numbered, and signed bookplate
This year marks the 125th anniversary of the birth of H.P. Lovecraft. He has been a huge influence on so many writers and artists, including Ben. DAGON was the first H.P. Lovecraft story that Ben ever read, and it has been his dream to be able to adapt DAGON in a graphic novel format, to be given a large amount of space to control pacing and truly convey the mood and depth within the tale while having complete design and production control of the book in creating a real experience. It finally feels like the right time to try and do this.
So for this Kickstarter, we’re asking you to help make this possible!
3-6-15 UPGRADE --> Every copy of the DAGON OBELISK edition will now come with this FREE 8.5x11" "The Thing Below" print that'll be embossed and signed by Ben!!
The Thing Below
3-6-15 UPGRADE --> Every copy of the DAGON book, whether it's the regular hardcover edition or the slipcased OBELISK edition, will now come with this FREE DADON bookmark!!
DAGON bookmark
2-11-15 UPGRADE --> Every copy of the DAGON book, whether it's the regular hardcover edition or the slipcased OBELISK edition, will now come with this FREE 8.5x11" portrait print of H.P. Lovecraft that'll be embossed and signed by Ben!!
H.P. Lovecraft looks good for being 125!!
CONTACT US IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS!
We're running this Kickstarter where the pledges don't simply accumulate one after another, but where the pledges are specifically created to get you more of exactly what you want!
So always feel free to email us through Kickstarter if you have any questions, are interested in upgrading your pledges, or if you have any requests for new/different pledges. We are here to help you in any way that we can!
SHIPPING INFO & RETURN POLICY
All pledges have U.S. shipping and handling already included!
International backers, please add additional stated amounts in each pledge for international shipping and handling to either Canada or everywhere else in the world. We did a country-by-country breakdown of the packages and approximate weights to determine this average amount.
To add the extra amount: When you select your pledge, a box will pop up displaying your current total pledge amount with the options for shipping outside the United States.
All sales are final. Packages may be insured by your request, and all claims for damaged packages/goods must be made with the shipping carrier.
PLEDGE ITEM DESCRIPTIONS
Here are descriptions and images for the items in each of the pledges. Contact us if you have any questions!
* FISHNCHIPS - KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE PRINT!
8.5x11" signed/embossed FISHNCHIPS paper print by Ben Templesmith. This is a Kickstarter exclusive print and will be limited to the total number of pledges here. The image goes edge-to-edge on this print!
* LANDLUBBER - KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE PRINT!
8.5x11" signed/embossed LANDLUBBER paper print by Ben Templesmith. This is a Kickstarter exclusive print and will be limited to the total number of pledges here. The image goes edge-to-edge on this print!
HERE'S WHAT THE TWO PRINT IMAGES LOOK LIKE TOGETHER!
The prints have been designed so that if you pledge for both prints, then they may be placed side-by-side seamlessly into one large image with an overall size of 17x11" for framing!
* DAGON HAND SILKSCREENED T-SHIRT
100% cotton pre-shrunk t-shirt available in ALL men's/women's sizes. These t-shirts are silkscreened by hand here in our studio and you can get either a black or green shirt! We will ask for your size, cut, and color through a survey.
* THE SQUIDDER KILL EM ALL HAND SILKSCREENED T-SHIRT
100% cotton pre-shrunk t-shirt available in ALL men's/women's sizes. These t-shirts are silkscreened by hand here in our studio and you can get either a black or green shirt! We will ask for your size, cut, and color through a survey.
* 44FLOOD BOOK PACKAGE FROM BEN TEMPLESMITH!
Did you miss out on Ben's past book projects at 44FLOOD? We have a $111 pledge that will get you the DAGON, LUST, and THE SQUIDDER hardcover books plus you'll get the LIBRETTO Volume 1: Vampirism book! And all books will be signed by Ben!
* ULTRA-LIMITED HAND-PAINTED SLIPCASED EDITION!!!
THIS ONE IS AMAZING!!! You'll get an ultra-limited DAGON painted slipcased edition where Ben will paint an original piece of art DIRECTLY ON the slipcase itself! Your book will truly be a one-of-a-kind piece of art! The medium used for the painting will be chosen by Ben and the subject he chooses will be based on the story.
* ORIGINAL ART FOR FISHNCHIPS PRINT - SOLD!!!
Done with pen/ink and ink wash on 8.5x11" card stock and signed by Ben.

Q&A
When will books, prints, and other pledges be shipped? 
- Each pledge has an estimated shipping date listed under its description. The DAGON books have an estimated shipping date of September 2015. If you buy prints with the book, then they will ship together. However, if you only buy prints, then they will ship in April 2015.
Can I add more items to my pledge?
- Yes! We want you to get exactly what you'd like! After choosing your pledge, message us through Kickstarter (click the "Ask a question" button on the bottom of this page) letting us know what items you would like to add. We'll let you know the additional cost and how to upgrade your pledge.
Can I change my address for shipping? 
- Once the time comes to start shipping, a survey will be sent out asking for your current address. We do this right before shipping to make sure we have your current address.
If you have any additional questions please click the "Ask a question" button on the bottom of the page, and we'll get back to you shortly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Everything in developing this book is being kept in-house by me as much as possible, such as the art scanning, book design, editing, and project management. I've used the printing company before to make another art book, but the fact is you never know if there will be issues or even delays at the printer. I'll do my best to keep you up-to-date if there are delays and give the reason why. For pledge fulfillment, my studio has been involved in several other Kickstarter campaigns, so I’m confident my studiomates and assistants will be ready to handle this as best and quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
