campaign.story:
The campaign may be over, but the spirit lives on. Join us at writeremergency.com to learn more about what's happening with Writer Emergency Pack.
---
Writing is hard. You're constantly trying to figure out what word comes next. 
Creative writing is even harder. When you're working on a story, you're not just trying to decide what word comes next, but what idea comes next.
It's easy to get stuck.
I know what that's like because I'm a screenwriter. I'm lucky to have had ten movies produced, from GO to BIG FISH to FRANKENWEENIE. I also host a popular podcast about film and television called Scriptnotes.
Over the years, I've had conversations with hundreds of writers, both on the podcast and around the lunch table. No matter what genre or medium, all writers face story problems. Plots that plod. Characters that don't connect.
Every writer has her own techniques for pushing past these problems -- little nudges and prompts to help get the story clicking. 
Writer Emergency Pack is a curated collection of some of the most useful suggestions I've encountered. It's by writers, for writers.
The Cards
Writer Emergency Pack contains 26 illustrated cards, each featuring a different idea for getting unstuck.
The notion of using cards to help you write isn't new. Writers have long used tarot cards, looking for meaning in the illustrations, or decks like Oblique Strategies, with its koan-like prompts ("Repetition is a form of change").
The ideas in Writer Emergency Pack are designed to be less abstract, and more immediately useful. They're specifically tailored to people writing fiction, from novels to scripts, poems to plays. 
The cards focus on story, character, and conflict.
For each illustrated Idea card, there's a matching Detail card with more specific suggestions. And on the back, you'll find tips to try.
Detail cards (front)
Detail cards (back)
Give One, Get One
Our goal is to get these packs into the hands of as many writers as possible — both the backers of the project and young writers just learning their craft. That's why we are committing to donate one deck for each backer deck we send out.
We're based in Los Angeles, so our initial outreach will be with programs we can visit to see what works. Ultimately, we want to send these packs all over the world. We've identified several youth writing programs we'd like to work with -- but we want your suggestions as well.
If you know of a creative writing program you'd like to recommend, tell us about it in the Comments section. Links and instructor names are especially helpful. Most important is your personal experience about why this particular program is so good.
As we learn more about how the Writer Emergency Packs are working for students, we'll be updating the Education page on writeremergency.com with tips and suggestions for using these decks with classes and after school programs.
Why Kickstarter
I mostly make digital things, like apps and podcasts and websites. In the digital world, it essentially costs the same to make ten or 10,000 copies of something. It's just bits. 
With physical goods, each unit has a real cost. When we printed demo versions of Writer Emergency Pack, each deck cost a lot. Some of that was for the paper and ink and cutting, but a lot of it was setup fees.
Those setup fees are largely fixed. If we printed 100 rather than 10, each deck would cost less. If we could print 500, they'd suddenly be affordable. 
You'll find lots of excellent playing card projects on Kickstarter, and this chart explains why -- making cards scales really well. As long as you can print enough at once, it's viable.
About the design
Ryan Nelson designed Writer Emergency Pack, drawing inspiration from publications of the 1950s -- handbooks, manuals and field guides with strong, bold typography. (In our case, Univers.)
We asked David Friesen to illustrate the cards. Each one is clever and packed with details. You'll be looking at these cards a lot, so we wanted them to be fun.
We also have some Kickstarter exclusives, including:
You can read about these two special perks in our update.
How This All Works
For many of you, this may be the first Kickstarter project you've backed. So here's a quick explanation of the process.
Kickstarter isn't a store, but you can think of it as a way to pre-order something that doesn't yet exist. 
When you pledge money, you pick which reward you want. For example, when you pledge $19, you get one Writer Emergency Pack.
If you pledge higher amounts, you can choose to get additional packs and other bonus stuff.
Once you've chosen, Kickstarter will send you to Amazon Payments, where they'll record your pledge. They don't bill you yet. They only charge you money at the end of the campaign, and only if we reach our funding goal ($9,000).
You can modify or cancel your pledge at any time until very close to the end of the campaign.
On the podcast, I've described Kickstarter as a way of bending the universe slightly. It's a way to make something happen that otherwise wouldn't. 
By backing Writer Emergency Pack, you're causing these cards to exist. Thank you.
Keep coming back for updates. You can also follow the project on Twitter @writeremergency and reach me @johnaugust
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PRODUCTION

All of the artwork and text is finished. We printed two runs of demo decks, which turned out great. We tested them with professional writers, students and teachers. The feedback has been terrific.

Despite our best planning, problems may arise: printing delays, earthquakes, gamma ray bursts that knock civilization back to the Stone Age. But short of global catastrophe, we should be okay. We've built in contingencies for budget and schedule that should get us through.

There's a chance we won't reach our funding goal. That would be a bummer. We would reevaluate and figure out how to do this better.

There's the chance the response could be so large that we are overwhelmed with orders. If that happens, we'll figure out how to add staff or work with a fulfillment service to get these shipments out. (There's actually a card in WEP named "Stack of Needles" which is about exactly this curse of success.)

Bottom line: If stuff comes up, we'll fix it, and we will tell you. You're backing this project because you want to bend the universe in a slightly better way. You deserve to know the highlights and hiccups along the journey.

SHIPPING

Our company (Quote-Unquote Films) has shipped thousands of shirts and USB drives for the Scriptnotes podcast. We're good at it. 

We've studied lots of other card-based Kickstarter projects to gather tips on fulfillment. Here are some things we've learned:

-> We need good addresses.

When funding concludes, we will be sending out a survey to get your mailing address. We plan to ship these in March, but it could be as early as mid-December. So PICK AN ADDRESS THAT WON'T CHANGE. If you're in college or moving a lot, that might mean sending it to your parents or a work address.

-> International shipping is expensive.

For deck-based projects, current consensus seems to be that USPS is the best value, even overseas. But we wish it were cheaper. One suggestion: Buy in bulk. If you know several people who want decks, pool your money and buy at a higher tier (i.e. Elite Dolphin Squad or Ocean Rescue Task Force). That way, you'll only pay shipping once.

-> Mistakes will happen.

Packages will get lost or stolen or held in customs. One good thing about these decks is that we're making a lot of them. No matter what happens, we'll be able to sort it out if you just contact us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Writer Emergency Pack, one year later
updates.update_content:
Exactly one year ago, we launched this Kickstarter for Writer Emergency Pack.
On that first day -- November 3, 2014 -- we brought in 464 backers and raised $14,055, surpassing our $9,000 goal for the entire campaign.
We were incredibly excited. But we didn’t have a sense of just how much bigger it would get.

updates.update_userinfo: New partners, new stores and a brand new project (called One Hit Kill)
updates.update_content:
Some quick updates on Writer Emergency Pack:
We hired an education consultant! Her name is Sarah Stephens. We found her through our friends at Young Storytellers. The daughter of teachers, Sarah will oversee getting the 8,000 education decks out to youth writing programs, including our new 826 partners. You can reach her through the site: writeremergency.com/education
In addition to our online store and Amazon, we’ve been testing out brick-and-mortar retail. You can find Writer Emergency Pack at Skylight Books and The Time Travel Mart in Los Angeles. It’s a whole new wholesale world. We’re not sure if we’re going to keep doing retail ourselves, or find a partner to help us distribute.

updates.update_userinfo: Writer Emergency Pack now in stores, and how online retail works
updates.update_content:
tl;dr -> thanks to you, we now have decks for purchase on the John August store and Amazon. 
As backers of Writer Emergency Pack, you helped us make something brand new. In December, you received the very first decks—nearly 8,000 of them, shipped by me and my friends out of my garage over the course of one very busy week.
It was exciting, exhausting and unrepeatable.

updates.update_userinfo: The finish line, and the start of the next race
updates.update_content: Every morning, I stumble downstairs, turn on the coffee maker and then switch on my phone. Along with that first hit of caffeine, I am delighted to see backers tweeting and Instagramming their Writer Emergency Packs.

updates.update_userinfo: How and why we shipped so quickly
updates.update_content: We began shipping Writer Emergency Pack last week. Quite a few backers have already received their decks. I've been getting tweets and photos like this:

Happy December, all. For those in the U.S., I hope you had a great Thanksgiving.
I'm back from a much-needed vacation, and excited for the next phase of this Kickstarter project: actually sending these decks out.
According to a CNNMoney study, upwards of 84% of successfully-funded Kickstarter projects shipped late.

We have about 20 hours left in the Writer Emergency Pack campaign -- it all ends Thursday at noon Pacific Standard Time.
Thanks to you, we way exceeded all our goals. With 5,300 backers, we're one of the top 0.4% of all projects in the history of Kickstarter.
And we've made so many decks. Remember this chart? I keep moving the arrow to the right.

With 49 hours to go, we are 180 awesome people short of reaching 5,000 backers for Writer Emergency Pack.
According to the useful charts at Kicktraq, it looks like we'll probably reach our goal just under the wire:

Last Sunday, when I sent out the update about How Playing Cards Are Made, we had 2,300 backers. Now we have nearly twice that. Which is crazy.

campaign.story:
All 12 stretch goals unlocked! Thank you!!! 
Vye has grown in quality and quantity since we first launched this kickstarter. The Kickstarter edition of Vye will now come with 110 linen finished cards, 125 wooden cubes, and a rule book, all in an upgraded awesome box. YOU made that happen.
If you missed out on the Kickstarter of Vye, but would still like to order it, you can do so at our company website: www.SandHatGames.com 
Thank you all again for the support and we’ll keep you updated on the development of the game as things progress. 
Joe, Doug and Vince of Sand Hat Games
“Vye is a kingdom building game at its most beautiful state.” Across the Board Games
“Would I recommend Vye? Without hesitation. It’s a fun and highly competitive card game of positioning and timing.” - Father Geek
Vye is an area control game that plays quickly across an ever increasing, and oftentimes contentious board, usually taking less than half an hour. The game is made up of 110 beautifully illustrated cards and 125 wooden tokens in 5 different colors. It has been favorably compared to Carcassonne, Fealty, Robber Knights and Go.
Vye is a game for 2-4 players, competing to build the largest kingdom... before the Inevitable Empress is drawn.  
Below is a quick "How to Play" video we put together for all of you. 
To play, you take five cards and lay them out as the unconquered lands of Vye. Players choose a color and put their matching house, and tokens in front of them. When played, each family member in a house claims neighboring cards with a unique trait. You’re dealt four cards and during your turn you can play from either your hand or from family. Playing your cards strategically enables you to capture your opponent’s lands and control the largest kingdom, thereby winning the game. Will you see your kingdom fractured or will you remain united and claim the kingdom of Vye before time runs out?
"Vye shines with its original artwork and design and is a terrific game to introduce to new gamers." Across the Board Games
 “Do play Vye the first chance you get and enjoy the challenge of capturing territory in an ever-shifting land dispute for power and control!” - Father Geek
We’ve had a lot of fun playing Vye and we’ve gotten a lot of great feedback and comments about the game. So much so that we wanted to give all of you the opportunity to try out our “pre-release edition” for free. Download the Print and Play of Vye below and if you like it please consider showing your support.
Download the Vye print and play kit here
Vye includes 60 Land cards, 20 Family cards, 24 special cards, 3 legendary cards, and an Inevitable Empress card. It also includes 5 different sets of colored wooden tokens (125 total) all in a beautifully designed box.

All stretch goals are designed to add variety and mix up gameplay to keep you on your toes (as you Vye for control of the kingdom)! All stretch goals will be included in every copy of Vye.
Our first stretch goal is to upgrade our standard, and totally acceptable, card stock finish to the much more impressive linen finish. This gives the cards a thicker more durable feel.
Wild Lands: Vye is a magical place and sometimes lands don’t take form until the moment of choosing. The Wild Lands are 4 new bonus cards you can add into the deck. Wild Lands take on the aspect of a neighboring land when played.
Winter's Vale: High in the mountains of Vye, is a place where the snow never melts, called Winter's Vale. Winter's Vale is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of a game.
Sinkhole: The world of Vye is falling into the earth. Giant, unexplainable sinkholes are swallowing up the lands of Vye making areas unpassable. Sinkholes are 4 new bonus cards you can add into the deck. They are placed on top of any existing land card. No kingdom can ever control that space again.  
Foxwood Marsh: Seeing the Foxwood Marsh, you might wonder why anyone would want to claim this foul smelling place for their kingdom. The creatures who live here are smarter, and more cunning than any animal should be. Some believe there is a Fox King at the heart of the bog ruling his minions with an ancient language only he remembers. The Foxwood Marsh is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of the game.
Catapult: In the battle for the kingdom of Vye, sometimes it helps have reach. The families have brought their own weapons of war onto the battlefield. Catapult adds 4 new cards to the game. Each player adds a Catapult next to their house at the start of the game and plays it as they would a Family card. The Catapult allows you to claim a land previously out of your reach.  
Hungry Seas: The seas of Vye are ripe for conquering. It takes a boldness and bravery to sail these treacherous waters against the leviathans that call it home. The Hungry Seas is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of the game.
Fortress: Command your ever-expanding kingdom with the indomitable Fortress. Providing you with a strong foothold in the contested lands of Vye, your Fortress can never be captured by your enemies and provides the lands surrounding it an imposing garrison. Fortress adds 4 new cards to the core set. Played from your sideboard along with your other Family cards, Fortress is sure to bring an exciting new dimension to your Vye games.
The Amber Jungle: What lurks in the remote depths of the Amber Jungle? Keep close watch as you explore the reaches of this newly discovered country, for predators known and unknown surely stalk this vibrant jungle land. The Amber Jungle is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of the game.
 Undermine: Divided realms will be reunited with the powerful Undermine card. While you own Undermine, you may count the score from two of your kingdoms instead of one. Undermine adds 4 new cards to the core set and is sure to bring earth-shattering dynamism to your Vye games.
Drover Reach: The pastoral reaches of Vye are perfect additions to your burgeoning realm. Drover Reach is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of the game.
The Lost City: The Lost Cities are thriving meccas of culture, influence and power. Long ago the inhabitants chose to remove themselves from society, learning to bend the minds of men to avoid their cities. However, you have found them and claimed their city as your own. The Lost City cards are 4 new bonus cards you can add into the deck. If they are in your largest kingdom at the end of the game, they increase your overall power.
Onyx Coast: Ancient castles stand vanguard over the realm known as the Onyx Coast. Their origins lost to time, these long-abandoned strongholds would be perfect conquests for your kingdom. Onyx Coast is a new set of 4 land cards you can add to a game as a replacement for existing lands or to extend the length of the game.
House of the Entangled Soul: Just who are these upstarts? Do they presume to divide your kingdom and take it for their own? Or will they be allies in your quest to rule Vye? The House of the Entangled Soul is a set of 4 new Family cards and 25 black tokens you can use in place of an existing family or to expand your Vye games to 5 player slug-fests! 
This stretch goal also unlocks an additional Catapult and Fortress card for the 5th family as well as 25 additional custom wooden tokens for the Collector's Edition version of the game.
Earthquake: The earth beneath your kingdom’s feet is not as stable as you might think. A sudden shift in the ground can cause lands you once controlled to slip away to a different part of the kingdom. In its place is a new land and potentially a new kingdom has appeared.
 Sanctuary: There’s a place in Vye, where even enemies coexist. This land is protected by the rulers of Vye and safe passage is always granted. The inhabitants are the castaway children of the houses - bastard sons and moon daughters. Though these children are not allowed in their own kingdoms, no house is willing to shed blood here, for fear that it would be their own.
 Necropolis: All things must die, but you can control who goes first. Watch how a kingdom’s forces, once powerful and mighty, turn to dust with the touch of the Necropolis.
Vye was created by three video game developers. We’ve spent our careers working on games such as inFAMOUS: Second Son, Diablo 3, Warhammer Online, City of Heroes, WildStar and more. Vye was developed in between two of those jobs. We wanted the perfect opener to getting hired: a game you could actually play in the interview, rather than just our resume of previous game experience. We knew the game would need to be quick to learn in order to immediately win over our audience of skeptical game developers. We never imagined that we’d create such a fun and beautiful game. Vye is that game and we can’t wait to share it with you.
Vye is in the final stages of development. The core game is solid and fun. We’re final testing some of the bonus cards to make sure everything flows smoothly. The art is being completed, with only a few cards remaining. We have our quote from our manufacturer and have determined how we’re going to fulfill orders when they come in.
All that remains is getting your support to make Vye a reality. If we hit our funding goal, we’ll be able to do a minimum print run of the game for you, the backers, and get Vye into game stores. We hope you’ll show us your support and back us.
  The three of us, Joe, Doug, and Vince, make up Sand Hat Games. We are a small company dedicated to making beautiful games for everyone to enjoy. Our professional background is in video game development, where we’ve spent years designing, writing and generally creating a lot of different games (Diablo 2, Diablo 3, City of Heroes, inFAMOUS, WildStar, and Warhammer Online). 
At home, we’ve worked on different projects from pen and paper RPGs to card and board games. Vye marks our first attempt to come together and produce something for everyone at Sand Hat Games, LLC. We hope to continue making gorgeous games that you love to play. Thank you for your support.

updates.update_content:
Welcome back, faithful supporters of Vye, in our last art update, we talked changes to our tokens. This update, we will talk about the card back and our changes to the box.
A Legacy-Thoughtful Card Back
When we decided to produce a second edition, we knew that we needed to consider a card back that would serve us for the lifetime of the game - expansions, promo cards, etc. would all need to use that same back. At the same time, we got a lot of feedback from players that they did not like seeing the copyright information on the back of the card. So we decided to explore a few new options. Here’s what we looked at:
New Rules Available for Download

Welcome back, honored friends of Vye, in our last update, we outlined some of the art and production changes we wanted for the second edition. In this update, we’ll take a more detailed look at the tokens.
As we played the first edition of Vye with co-workers, family, friends, and at FLGS tables in various cities (where we met some awesome and enthusiastic people!), we started to notice a trend in the execution of the game from a component perspective - specifically that, under some lighting conditions, we could not see the black tokens on the cards and it could be challenging to tell the blue from the black tokens. Additionally, as we encountered players with various forms of color vision, we discovered our token colors didn’t hold up well. So, we decided to change things.

updates.update_content:
Hello, faithful supporters of Vye! This is Doug Woolsey and, over the next few weeks, I will be talking about some of the art and production changes you’ll see in the upcoming Second Edition of Vye.
When our supply of the first edition of Vye was getting low in the summer of 2015, we knew we needed to get another run produced as soon as possible. We began talking with our printing partner, BangWee, to gather cost and timeline information, and tried to figure out how much of our game we could alter for the second printing. We knew that, at a minimum, there were some rulebook changes we wanted to make and we wanted to do something, if possible, about the serious problem we were having with the token colors. The cost of the changes both in manufacturing and time started a larger conversation about what changes a second printing of Vye really needed. We identified a number of core things about the game and its components that we felt needed change and realized that, if we made all of the changes we wanted, not only would we produce a better game than the already great game we had made, but that there would be enough changes that we needed to starkly identify it as different from the first edition. Thus, the second edition was born. We had our list of design, art, and production changes, we chose a chunk of time for the production of the list, and we began working through the items meeting weekly to discuss our progress.
Greetings and salutations, my fine crowdfunding affectionados. It has been too long since we last gave you an update and here’s why (cue drumroll…) The Second Edition of Vye is coming!

Great news! We’ve officially shipped half of the Vye Collector’s Editions. The manufacturing and assembly continues at full speed. If you purchased a Collector’s Edition, rest assured we are getting them out as fast as they are coming in. We appreciate your patience and we are confident you will LOVE your Collector’s Edition when it arrives shortly.
As of this week, we're shipping the last of the regular editions of Vye out to our backers! If you haven’t gotten yours yet, not to worry, it’s “in the mail.”
